description.hltext_display: BRIEF: Malaysia fire kills four in a family
description.content:
(The Star - McClatchy-Tribune Information Services via COMTEX) -- GEORGE TOWN (THE STAR/ANN) -- Four family members perished in a fire that razed a double-storey shophouse in Perak Road, Jelutong, Malaysia, at about 2.40am Wednesday morning.
Shop owner Neoh Hooi Poh, 57, managed to escape in the nick of time but his wife Goeh Siew Keow, 56, daughter Neoh Li Hong, 18, and son Neoh Soo Aik, 16, died in the incident.
Hooi Poh's mother Lim Chye Hwa, 73, fainted and died on the way to the Penang Hospital.
A total of 35 firemen in five fire engines and four voluntary fire-fighting teams were summoned to douse the fire.
A Fire and Rescue Department spokesman said they received the distress call at about 2.50am.
To see more of the Asia News Network, go to http://www.asianewsnet.net/home/ Copyright (c) 2010, The Star, Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia / Asia News Network Distributed by McClatchy-Tribune Information Services. For more information about the content services offered by McClatchy-Tribune Information Services (MCT), visit www.mctinfoservices.com.
[ Back To greentechnologyworld.com's Homepage ]

description.hltext_display: New Form on its way
description.content: It is high time for an action plan when it comes to increasing Swedish Design Export. At least it is a topic of great interest for many of us, and 40 guests came to join our breakfast meeting on Dec 9 at Svensk Form. The goal was to discuss how we can find a long term strategy to work on increased Swedish Design Export, and how to strengthen our international collaboration and exchange overall. I had invited our main promotion public promotion authorities, cultural institutions, design organisations, companies and individual designers. We all agreed on the need, whether the target was increased export, nation branding, increasing image and awareness, diversity, exchange and internationalisation generally. I gave a brief talk on Svensk Form's new internationalisation strategy for the next three years, including the English edition of Form, and the exhibitions touring + the manifestations we hope to realize in Milan, Berlin, London in 2011 + New York and Tokyo in 2012. To really create a Svensk Form international, and a platform for design companies and designers, we really would need 6 million SEK over three years (not much if you compare to our Nordic neighbours, who are investing strongly in design promotion) Other speakers were Thomas Brühl from VisitSweden and their strong nation branding strategy which will be launched in full in the spring, including design, fashion and food as core values. Jens Söderblom representing our Minister of Trade Ewa Björling, also stressed her engagement in increasing export of design and fashion. Anders Hallersjö of Swedish Trade Council, also talked about how the Trade Council works with these export issues, but wanted a long term plan, not just singular events on an ad hoc basis. Maria Sandow from Svensk Handel, told about their work mainly with the fashion companies and the Sustainable Product Academy. Åsa Lundmark from the Swedish Institute talked about the Design & Fashion exhibitions where the Swedish Institute is involved as a part of promoting the image of contemporary Sweden abroad. Ellen Wettmark of The Cultural Council, stressed the importance of bringing international culture to Sweden, to increase the diversity and to stimulate the cultural development here. I do believe that it is important to include the cultural organisations and the Ministry of Culture in these connections too, since the cultural and conceptual aspects are just as important as the business aspects and they do go hand in hand. Anders Wisth, from the clusters of furniture producers of southern Sweden, gave an inspiring talk on local production, high quality and importance of common strategy. Lets hope this will finally happen! ACTION PLAN NEEDED

description.hltext_display: Microsoft is back in mobile - 1.5m Windows Phone 7 devices sold
description.content:
.?We have 18,000 developers who are developing for our marketplace. It?s just getting better and better.?Can take on the might of Android and iOS?
Effectively Microsoft has had to re-establish its credentials in the smartphone business. It?s previous Windows Mobile platform had become jaded in the slipstream of Apple iPhone and the company went back to the drawing board.
In the interim Google established itself rather swiftly with Android and is positioned to overtake Apple?s iOS in terms of market penetration. At present up to 18pc of smartphones in the world are powered by Android ? no mean achievement in just two years. Microsoft has its work cut out for it.?We all know that the competition is extreme in this industry, and we have to compete on multiple fronts. We have to deliver a great product that people want to use,? Berg said.?We have a different point of view than just delivering apps, and we have received great customer feedback on our approach. We are working on updates that will take us to the next level. Plus, we have great support from the ecosystem including developers, operators and device manufacturers, which will add to momentum we are already seeing.?From this perspective, we?re in a good place. We are on a path to begin releasing the first of several updates in the next couple of months, and several more mobile operators around the world will introduce on their network in 2011 and we will have at different price points delivering on our commitment of providing customers choice.?We believe doing these things right will lead to continued success,? Berg said. John Kennedy

description.hltext_display: PRECIOUS METALS - European Morning View - Precious metals gain on lingering Eurozone debt jitters
description.content:
EUR/USD tested to 1.32 after China's Vice Premier said China had played its part to ease Europe's plight and hoped that a turning point was near. However, the Eurozone currency turned lower later in the day, closing down 0.2% against the dollar and yen after Moody's warned it may downgrade Portugal's credit rating by one-two notches, reinforcing speculation the debt crisis will continue well into 2011. The single currency has regained some ground overnight on a mix of short covering and rumours of stops above the market; EUR/USD & EUR/JPY are both currently up around 0.3%.
Broad gains were seen across the equity sector yesterday with the Nikkei closing at a seven-month high; the FTSE up 1%, the S&P500 0.6% and Dow 0.5%. Sentiment has turned more mixed overnight though; the MSCI Asia Pacific Index is up 0.3% while the Nikkei is off 0.2% after the Japanese government forecast growth to slow next year from 3.1% this year to 1.5% as yen strength threatens exports.
Economic data today includes Italian Retail Sales; UK GDP & Revised Business Investment, US Existing Home Sales and final GDP. The Bank of England will also release the minutes of the latest MPC meeting and may prove interesting given the recent rate increase forecast from the CBI.
Gold closed Tuesday unchanged after trading in a $12 range and silver posted a small 0.2% decline. The PGMs however settled upbeat with platinum up 0.6% and palladium 1%, gaining on the increase in risk appetite and rally in the base metals. Gains have been seen across the complex this morning although the PGMs have backed off their highs after platinum touched a two-week peak of $1735. Given the thin conditions and proximity to year-end there is the risk of profit taking across the metals, however the ongoing debt issues in Europe together with background geo-political tension in Korea and concerns about inflation, the complex, particularly gold, looks set to maintain its upwards trend in the coming weeks to challenge resistance around $1425 and the all-time high of $1431.30.

description.hltext_display: South Korea holds largest ever live-fire military drill
description.content:
Today South Korea is holding the largest ever live-fire military drill.
An air, land and sea combat firing exercise is being held in the vicinity of North Koreas border. The three-day drill involves some 800 troops, several helicopters, combat planes, artillery, missiles and naval ships.
The situation on the Korea Peninsula remains heated following North Koreas shelling of an area near Yongpyeong Island in the Yellow Sea on the 23rd of last month.
The shelling killed several civilian residents of the island.
This past Monday the South Korean military ignored Russias appeal to abstain from a naval gunnery practice and did hold it in the area of Yongpyenog Island.

description.hltext_display: Kings of Leon Cancel London Show Due to Fire
description.author: MICHAEL PRESTON
description.content:
For the second time this year, the Kings of Leon were forced to cancel a show because of a freak accident.
The arena rock band, which was set to do a show at London's 02 Arena, had to postpone the gig after their tour buses caught on fire, reports the BBC.
The blaze started in a loading bay and spread from one bus to the other. 60 firefighters were called to the scene and six people were eventually treated for smoke inhalation.
A survey of the damage led to the show's cancellation. "Unfortunately, once the assessments were completed in full, there was not enough time to set up the show for tonight's performance," a spokesman for the 02 said.
A spokesman for the London Fire Brigade (LFB) said that while no damage had been done to the arena, both buses had been completely hollowed out by the fire, leaving little time to set up the show. "Our crew did a fantastic job, especially given the levels of smoke down here which has led to quite challenging conditions," said LFB sation manager Sally Cartwright.
Earlier this year at a gig in St. Louis, the band walked off mid-performance after pigeon droppings bombarded the stage. Singer Jared Followill was hit in the face and mouth with the bird's droppings and the band deemed the conditions too unsanitary to continue.
Suggested Reading: BBC, New York Times, New York

description.hltext_display: Sumitomo, Nissan and NEC to Promote Membership-based Charging Service for Electric Vehicles (EV)
description.content:
Tweet - Collaboration Set to Improve User Convenience in the Charging Network - Sumitomo Corporation Nissan Motor Co., Ltd. NEC Corporation
YOKOHAMA (Dec. 21, 2010) ? Sumitomo Corporation, Nissan Motor Co., Ltd. and NEC Corporation today announced that they have signed a Memorandum of Understanding (MOU) to promote a new membership-based charging service for EV users that will be available for the first time nationwide in Japan.
Under the MOU, the three companies will conduct a joint study to develop charging facilities which can provide continuous service to EV users and maintenance of charging equipment by working with existing service providers. They will also establish a business model for the charging infrastructure that will give convenience to EV users by optimally installing standard charging facilities and quick chargers at key strategic locations, including provisions of charging facilities for residents of apartment buildings and monthly parking users. In addition, future use of charging facilities by plug-in hybrid vehicles will also be studied.
Sumitomo also launched the New Business Development & Promotion Division, which is responsible for environmental businesses and is working on developing new approaches to realizing a low-carbon, recycling-based society. Aiming to realize such a society, the company will also support the widespread adoption of next-generation vehicles including EV through the second-life use of lithium-ion batteries for automotive use, the development of the system that facilitates ?Green IT? and the auto lease business by its affiliate company, Sumitomo Mitsui Auto Service Company.
With the goal of becoming a global leader in zero-emission mobility, Nissan launched its mass-market EV, Nissan LEAF in Japan on December 20th with Nissan-developed quick chargers going on sale previously in May. Through the new service, the company intends to accelerate the development of infrastructure essential to promoting EV and achieve both greater convenience to users and business feasibility.
NEC will provide various systems utilizing cloud computing in the membership management, including quick charging services, member authentication and payment processing. Through this new business, the company will improve convenience for users with the establishment of a new infrastructure that takes advantage of networked charging facilities and ICT technologies to promote a whole new service that will contribute to the environment.
In order to create further synergy for the business, the three companies will leverage their combined know-how in gaining support from a wide-range of organizations from all industries. The first trial service is set to start within Kanagawa prefecture early next fiscal year, in collaboration with the prefecture and its local governments.
For more information, contact Sumitomo Corporation Corporate Communications Department Tel: +81-(0)3-5166-3100 E-Mail?press } sumitomocorp.co(.)jp
Nissan Motor Co., Ltd. Communications CSR Department Global Communications CSR and IR Division Tel: +81-(0)45-523-5521
http://www.nissan-newsroom.com/JPN/en/
http://www.nissan-zeroemission.com/EN/

Zweites Treffen des Arbeitskreises Service- Business am FIR
description.content:
16 Unternehmer tauschen sich über ihr Service-Business aus
(PresseBox) Aachen, 22.12.2010, Das FIR an der RWTH Aachen veranstaltet seit dem 15. September 2010 bis zu viermal jährlich den Arbeitskreis "Service- Business". Während der Treffen tauschen sich Experten des Servicegeschäfts über aktuelle Herausforderungen, Lösungen, Methoden und Erfahrungen im Bereich der industriellen Dienstleistungen aus. Das zweite der kostenlosen Arbeitskreistreffen fand am 13. Dezember in den Institutsräumen des FIR am Pontdriesch 14/16 in Aachen statt. 16 Vertreter namhafter Unternehmen wohnten der Veranstaltung bei. Thema des zweiten Arbeitskreises war der "Kundennutzen" im Servicegeschäft. "Während des Treffens haben wir beleuchtet, wie Unternehmen den Nutzen verschiedener Serviceleistungen bewerten. Aktuelle Herausforderungen bestehen derzeit in der Preisfindung und im Bewusstsein für Serviceleistungen", erklärt Christian Grefrath, Wissenschaftler am FIR und Organisator des Arbeitskreises. Während des Arbeitskreises konnten sich die Teilnehmer über ihre Erfahrungen beispielsweise bei der Kundennutzenbestimmung austauschen. Derzeit nutzen die meisten Unternehmen dazu Fragebögen. Als problematisch sehen die Teilnehmer, dass für Befragungen in der Regel nur die Anwender aus Unternehmen zur Verfügung stehen, nicht aber Entscheider oder gar die Geschäftsführer. Zudem erachten die Mitglieder des Arbeitskreises es als schwierig, die Unternehmen zur Teilnahme an Umfragen zu motivieren. Gründe für geringe Teilnahmequoten bei Umfragen sahen die Teilnehmer in der Zeit, in der Meinungsbefragungen durchgeführt werden. Umfragen erfolgten meistens zu spät. "Es ist wichtig, Umfragen regelmäßig durchzuführen, damit die Trends zeitig erkannt und Probleme herausgestellt werden, bevor die Kunden zur Konkurrenz abwandern", erklärt Grefrath. Zudem sollten Fachkräfte die Umfragen durchführen, die Rückfragen der Kunden beantworten können. Am Nachmittag besichtigten die Teilnehmer des Arbeitskreises das Service- Science-Innovation-Lab - ein Forschungslabor des FIR, in dem mithilfe modernster Technologie Dienstleistungsideen, Prozesse und Prototypen entwickelt werden. In dem Labor wurde den Gästen der Kundenorientierungscheck in Bezug auf den Kundennutzen vorgeführt. Dieser Check macht den Unternehmen deutlich, in welchen Arbeitsbereichen sie noch nicht kundenorientiert handeln und welche Handlungsfelder sich darauf ableiten lassen. In einer abschließenden Gruppenarbeit konnten die Teilnehmer eigenständig den Check in dem Labor in Teilen durchführen. Das nächste Treffen des Arbeitskreises findet im Frühjahr 2011 statt. Der genaue Termin wird mit den Teilnehmern noch abgestimmt. Weitere Informationen zu der Veranstaltung sind online abrufbar: www.service-business.net
Über Forschungsinstitut für Rationalisierung (FIR) an der RWTH Aachen
Das Forschungsinstitut für Rationalisierung e. V. (FIR) ist ein selbstständiger Forschungsdienstleister an der RWTH Aachen mit mehr als 55-jähriger Erfahrung in der Entwicklung und Anwendung von Methoden zur Steigerung von Wachstum und Beschäftigung. Das FIR ist Mitglied der Arbeitsgemeinschaft industrieller Forschungsvereinigungen (AiF) und zählt rund 150 Mitgliedsunternehmen und Verbände mit mehr als 50 000 angeschlossenen Unternehmen. In den drei Forschungsbereichen Dienstleistungsmanagement, Informationsmanagement und Produktionsmanagement gestalten in einer Netzorganisation rund 120 wissenschaftliche Mitarbeiter und studentische Hilfskräfte die Betriebsorganisation im Unternehmen der Zukunft.

description.hltext_display: BRIEF: Malaysian beauty Hannah Tan launches her own iPhone app
Cierre de aeropuertos afecta la Navidad
description.content:
Vuelos suspendidos EUROPA. En vísperas de Navidad, miles de pasajeros siguen atrapados en varios aeropuertos europeos por el temporal de nieve en el continente, situación que amenaza con extenderse a las carreteras y el ferrocarril de algunos países.
En Alemania, los problemas en los aeropuertos, especialmente en el de Fráncfort, están extendiéndose a los transportes ferroviario y terrestre después de que cayeran de nuevo por la noche copiosas nevadas. El tráfico terrestre continuaba siendo problemático después de que la dirección de la compañía ferroviaria Deutsche Bahn recomendara el pasado domingo a los viajeros que se abstuvieran en lo posible de tomar el tren a causa de los retrasos y los cortes temporales en todo el país.
En Francia, unas 4 000 personas tuvieron que dormir en los dos aeropuertos de París (Charles de Gaulle y Orly) y en varias estaciones de ferrocarril de la ciudad por la imposibilidad de tomar los aviones o los trenes a causa de la nieve invernal.
La ministra francesa de Ecología, Nathalie Kociusko Morizet, admitió que los problemas en los dos aeropuertos de París no podrán resolverse en las próximas horas por los retrasos y anulaciones causados por las perturbaciones en los aeropuertos británicos y alemanes.
En el Reino Unido, las bajas temperaturas y la nieve siguen causando problemas en la red de transporte, principalmente en los aeropuertos. El más afectado es el de Heathrow Londres , donde cientos de personas han vuelto a pasar la noche en la terminal tras ver anulados sus vuelos, mientras que Gatwick (sur de Londres) solo pudo empezar a operar a las 06:00 GMT (23:00 del Ecuador).
La aerolínea British Airways (BA) informó que habrá trastornos importantes hacia Heathrow por el cierre de la segunda pista en este aeropuerto. (EFE) ... Ver mas

description.hltext_display: Duitse verpleger misbruikte kinderen onder narcose
description.content:
Een Duitse verpleger zou drie jongetjes seksueel hebben misbruikt. De slachtoffertjes waren telkens onder narcose. De 27-jarige gruwel filmde zijn daden met zijn gsm.Het ging om kinderen die op de afdeling intensieve zorgen verbleven. Een kind, een jongen van negen, was echter niet volledig onder narcose. Hij was zich als het ware bewust van het misbruik, tot twee keer toe. Van zodra hij kon, vertelde hij zijn ouders wat er was gebeurd.
De politie hield daarop een huiszoeking in de woonst van de verpleger. Daar werden video's en foto's van de handelingen gevonden.
De man werd vrijdag al ingerekend. Hij werd naar een penitentiair ziekenhuis uit vrees dat hij zelfmoord zou plegen. Daar heeft hij zich intussen met een scheermesje gecastreerd en zich gesneden in armen en benen. Hij verkeert in levensgevaar.

description.content: HAMILTON - A study into the pay rates for Butler County’s nonunion workers suggests the county could save more than $200,000 in the first year by eliminating step raises.

description.hltext_display: Chinese netizens asked to vote 'yes' or forget it
Lluvias causan caos
description.content:
Temporal en el mundo En Colombia y en California, miles de personas han tenido que abandonar sus hogares BOGOTÁ. Las intensas lluvias siguen castigando a Colombia, país en el que 284 personas han muerto a lo largo de 2010 por desastres asociados a las precipitaciones, informó ayer el Gobierno, mientras continúa la evacuación de pueblos que están sumergidos en el agua.
Además de los 284 fallecidos, el Ministerio del Interior registraba hasta ayer 267 heridos, 62 desaparecidos, 2 155 386 personas afectadas, 3 173 viviendas destruidas y 310 351 viviendas averiadas. Las regiones en peor situación son Bolívar, Magdalena, Atlántico, Guajira, Córdoba, Sucre y Cesar, en el norte; Chocó y Antioquia, en el noroeste, y Valle del Cauca, en el oeste.
Ayer, la Marina de Guerra completó el desalojo del pueblo Soplaviento (Bolívar), de donde fueron sacados sus 2 000 habitantes debido a las inundaciones.
En las últimas semanas, el desbordamiento de ríos ha obligado a la evacuación de pueblos enteros, como es el caso de Gramalote (este), en el que las lluvias profundizaron una falla geológica y calles y viviendas se hundieron. Los habitantes de Gramalote fueron llevados en su mayoría a la ciudad de Cúcuta (norte), en la que se alojan en albergues. Hasta ahora, la Cruz Roja colombiana ha entregado casi 900 toneladas de ayuda humanitaria a los damnificados, que han sido destinadas a 56 mil familias afectadas.
Las lluvias complican también la movilidad en el país, con 50 vías totalmente cerradas y otras 265 con paso restringido, según la Policía de carreteras. Mientras, el Gobierno colombiano calcula que la atención de los desastres dejados por las lluvias costará alrededor de $5 000 millones.
EEUU. Por otro lado, las intensas lluvias que azotan a California (EEUU) han obligado a las autoridades a evacuar comunidades agrícolas y a realizar rescates cerca de ríos, mientras se reparten bolsas de arena contra inundaciones, se abren refugios y se reportan apagones.
Los bomberos han evacuado a habitantes de casas ubicadas en zonas de riesgo de derrumbes o inundaciones en los condados de Los Ángeles y San Bernardino.
En el centro de Los Ángeles, se ha acumulado casi 13 cm de lluvia desde el viernes pasado, que representa más de la tercera parte del promedio de precipitación anual. Más de 25,4 cm de lluvia han caído en las zonas montañosas del sur de California, mientras que cerca de San Francisco, las colinas quedaron tapadas de nieve. (AFP) ... Ver mas

Medvedev to visit Taj Mahal, Bolywood
description.content:
Dmitry Medvedev is ending his by visiting two of the countrys prominent cities.
Today in Agra the Russian leader is enjoying the sight of one of the worlds manmade wonders, - the 17th century mausoleum-mosque Taj Mahal, which has been put on the UNESCO world heritage list.
The Taj Mahal is the pride and symbol of India.
After that Dmitry Medvedev is scheduled to visit the countrys business and financial centre, Mumbai, to meet the student body of the local Technological Institute and visit the dream factory, - the Bollywood film studios.
Russia and India signed 30 agreements following Medvedevs official talks in Delhi on Tuesday.

British Airways Cabin Crew Begin 2011 Strike Ballot
description.author: John Morgan
description.content:
The cabin crew at British Airways have started the ballot on if they will hold fresh strikes next year. Unite says the ballot papers are being sent to over 10,000 of their members, warning that the long-running dispute with the carrier is deepening. The voting period is due to conclude on January 21.
This bitter row started over cost-cutting measures that the airline introduced, mostly at Heathrow Airport, where their crew are paid the most. However, the dispute worsened when the workers’ travel concessions were taken away from them if they participated in the industrial action earlier this year. Some union members also suffered disciplinary action.
Unite joint general secretary Tony Woodley said that the issue was making savings to help the company through a tough period for the aviation industry. The union offered multimillion pound concessions that all but met the requirements of management, he continued. British Airways preferred imposition, he explained, and provoked a dispute that has cost them much more and damaged their reputation.
Woodley went on to say that the dispute has been lengthened by ‘vindictive measures’ toward cabin crew, with almost 70% of loyal workers being put through hell and 13 being sacked in recent months because they supported the union. The carrier knows what they have to do to end the row, as the issues would cost nothing to resolve, he added, but it’s a matter of them showing the leadership to get back to the negotiating table to settle this.
Unite members held a total of 22 days of strikes this year, costing British Airways nearly £ 150 million. With so much travel chaos going on from strikes and the severe weather in the UK, travelers would like nothing more than to have all transport services back to normal, so another walkout is more than unwanted. description.hltext_display: BERKSHIRE LEAGUE SWIMMING AND DIVING: Hungry teams ready to gun for Shepaug; Spartans have won past nine league championships
description.content:
Who will knock off Shepaug?
The Spartans have won nine straight Berkshire League championships, 27 overall. Shepaug lost a lot to graduation, but as seems to be the case every year, the Spartans bring back plenty of talent. There are 12 seniors, led by captains Richard Baron, Patrick Firmender and Colleen Lavaway. They are joined by junior captain Gina DeMeo. The seniors look to groom 12 freshmen and help them learn how to carry on the winning tradition at Shepaug.
Even Shepaug’s competition knows beating the Spartans will not be an easy task.
“Shepaug as always is the favorite,” long-time Litchfield coach Bill Dranginis said in an e-mail.
Dranginis, however, sees challenges to Shepaug’s rein.
“We, along with Lewis Mills, who has the No. 1 swimmer in the state in Luke Zalewski and (Northwestern) should be challenging them for the top spot.”
Litchfield may be young, but they are deep and talented. Dranginis brings back several high performers, including junior Eric Sandrib (No. 1 breaststroke, No. 1 200 IM); junior Aiden Dyer (No. 1 distance freestyle); and junior Nick Rinaldi (top returning butterfly and 50 freestyle). The Cowboys also return a BL All-Star team in the 400 free relay. They are Emily Protzmann, Kelly Lewis, Elaine Hill and Libby Zampaglione.
“We have one of our youngest but deepest and most versatile teams in years and are lookng forward to a very strong season,” Dranginis said. Continued...
Reader Comments »
View reader comments (0) » Comment on this story »
Litchfield already started throwing its weight around this season with a win over Lewis Mills. The Cowboys had lost six straight to the Spartans before this year.
“Litchfield will be the team to watch this season, with many strong swimmers returning,” Ingvertsen said. “Shepaug, despite their large numbers lost, are always a team to reckon with, as well as (Northwestern).”
Mills has dropped meets to both Shepaug and Litchfield early on this season, but the Spartans are always dangerous.
Ingvertsen’s goal is to still have her team be competitive at the highest levels of the Berkshire League.
“With strong individual swimmers, LSM will need to build depth this year, and looks to fill some spots that are lacking,” Spartans coach Kristen Ingvertsen said in an e-mail. “A lower number of athletes presents difficulty, but allows many individual swimmers to work on and perfect their skills, as well as learn new strokes and fill spots.”
Lewis Mills lost Leon Gunzl and Todd Satherlie, a pair of All-State performers. The Spartans, however, return senior phenom Luke Zalewski.
Northwestern brings back some talent of its own in Katie Sterpka and Phil Smith. The Highlanders, however, will also need to develop depth.
“We are a very young team, however we should be very competitive,” coach Mary DiMauro said in an e-mail.
Not only were there major graduations since last season, but a familiar face is gone from pool side. Harry Dauphinais retired as Gilbert coach. Dave Gabelman is in his first season and must develop depth around a few strong individuals.
Wamogo brings back some experienced swimmers, and coach Bill Houle looks for improvement over last year’s 5-11 mark. Continued...
Reader Comments »
View reader comments (0) » Comment on this story »
At Housatonic, it will be a rebuilding year for long-time coach Jacqueline Rice. Rice has just 20 swimmers and lost senior depth to graduation. The Mountaineers look to improve their times at every meet.
In the end, it comes back to the same question. Who will stop Shepaug?
Several rivals hope to have the answer at season’s end.
GILBERT
Head coach: Dave Gabelman, 1st season
Last year: 17th in Class S
Key losses: Jared Groth; Nick Berger; Davis Cappabianca; Bridie McCarthy
Returners: Briana Brady (jr.); Brock Flieger (jr.); Kate Ellsworth (jr.); Billy Shopey (jr.); Jonah Hewitt (jr.); Justin Morhardt (jr.); Carolina Morales (jr.); Ian Ellsworth (soph.)
Newcomers: Luke Snyder (fr.)
Team/League outlook: Gabelman replaces long-time coach Harry Dauphinais, who retired. Continued...
Reader Comments »
View reader comments (0) » Comment on this story »
HOUSATONIC
Head coach: Jacqueline Rice
Key losses: depth
Key returners: Travis Derr (sr., freestyle); Megan Fisher (sr.); Bailey Phelps (sr.); Regan Carroll (jr.)
Team/League outlook: Rice will look to rebuild depth after losing a lot of it to graduation. Housatonic is a small program, with just 20 members.
Housatonic picked up a win apiece from Megan Fisher (100 backstroke) and Regan Carroll (100 breaststroke), along with a first place finish in the 400 free relay (team of Matt Rogers, Travis Derr, Gabe Lefferts, and Brandon Carlson).
LEWIS MILLS
Head coach: Kristen Ingvertsen, 8th season. Assistant coach: Jenny Mancini, 5th season
Last year: 11-5 regular season; 5th in Class S; 18th at State Open
Key losses: Leon Gunzl (All-State backstroke and freestyle); Todd Satherlie (All-State breaststroke)
Key returners: Luke Zalewski (sr.); Michael Haaser (sr.); Tori Williams (sr.); Lena Gunzl (jr.); Hailey Martel (jr.); Landon Butler (jr.); Brent Satherlie (jr.)
Key newcomers: Parker Colby (jr.); Alise Martel (fr.)
Team outlook: The Spartans expect to stay at the top of the BL, but the fight to stay there will be even harder with the losses of Gunzl and Todd Satherlie to graduation. Mills has strong individual swimmers, but will need to develop depth.
LITCHFIELD
Head coach: Bill Dranginis, 23 years
Last year’s record: 8-6 overall (7-5 BL); 10th in Class S championship
Key losses: Joe O’Leary (No. 1 butterfly); Adam Stanley (No. 1 diver, No. 1 freestyle); Tim Crampton (No. 1 50 freestyle; No. 2 100 freestyle); Shannon Dunn; Connor Malarkey; Aaron Montiel
Key returners: Anna Lagatutta (sr., top returning female distance freestyle); Carrie Rindos (sr., No. 2 female breaststroke); Arty Adili (sr., freestyle); Sara Peterson (jr., diving); Eric Sandrib (jr., No. 1 breaststroke, No. 1 200 individual medley); Aiden Dyer (jr., No. 1 distance freestyle); Nick Rinaldi (jr., top returning butterfly, top returning 50 freestyle); Conor Dieck (jr., breaststroke); Joe Janice (soph., breaststroke/freestyle); Zack Crane (soph., individual medley/distance relay); Henry Kavle (soph., distance freestyle); Ryan Schoerner (soph., freestyle); Luisa Meharg (soph., breaststroke); 400-freestyle relay BL All-Stars Emily Protzmann, Kelly Lewis, Elaine Hill, Libby Zampaglione
Key newcomers: Colin Dunn (individual medley); Mackenna Stanley (diving)
Outlook: Dranginis sees Shepaug as the favorite, but plans on watching his team, along with Lewis Mills and Northwestern, put up a strong challenge for the top spot.
NORTHWESTERN
Head coach: Mary DiMauro, 2nd year (5th overall with program)
Last year’s record: 7-7-1; 15th in Class S
Key losses: Matt Cunningham; Tom Smith; Ryan Collins; Mike English; Ben Cassell; Jeremy Starn; Colleen King; Kati Hinman; Colleen Traub; Elise Wignall; Chelsea Condon
Key returners: Katelyn Zeitler; Mellissa Traub; Elise Allyn; Katie Sterpka; Phil Smith; Alex Campbell; Mollie Traub; Patrick Reece
Team outlook: The Highlanders are young, but plan on being very competitive.
SHEPAUG
Head coach: Todd Dyer, 6th year
Last year: 9th in Class S; 48th at State Open
Key losses: Nick Velseboer; Patrick O’Brien; Cody Heimbrock; Adam Mennonna; Evan Wright; Christina Dumas
Key returners: Patrick Firmender (sr.); Richard Baron (sr.); Colleen Lavaway (sr.); Ross Mackay (sr.); Evan Garrity (sr.); Gina DeMeo (jr.).; Griffin DeCaro (jr.); Logan Ross (soph.)
Team/League outlook: As always, the Spartans will look to be at or near the top of the BL. They have captured the last nine Berkshire League titles. Shepaug has a large mix of seniors (12) and freshman (12), with plenty of others in between.
WAMOGO
Head coach: Bill Houle, 8 years
Last year’s record: 5-11; 21st in Class S
Key loss: Taylor Komisar (all strokes)
Key returners: Alexa Serafine (sr., all strokes); Olivia Martin (sr., all strokes); Collin Felton (sr., sprinter); Anne Carlson (jr., middle distance); Steve Rosko (soph., sprinter); Kevin Brown (jr., breastroke); Tim Lucas (soph., middle distance); Jed Gravel (soph., middle distance); Alex Brady (soph., sprinter); Alexa Amorosa (soph., breaststroke); Justin Manley (soph., backstroke); Dani Core (sr., diver); Alex Siladi (sr., all strokes)
Key newcomers: Evan Dalke (fr., sprinter); Raphael Rodrigues (fr., breaststroke); Robin Carlson (fr., sprinter)
Outlook: The Warriors look to improve and be more competitive. Houle expects the favorites to be Litchfield, Shepaug, Lewis Mills and Northwestern.

description.hltext_display: Venezuela: Chávez con el control total de medios
description.content:
Libertad de información En la reforma a la ley de telecomunicaciones, se declara a este sector como un servicio público, reduce además los lapsos de concesiones y limita la inversión extranjera CARACAS. La mayoría oficialista del Parlamento de Venezuela aprobó la noche del lunes pasado una reforma legal que declaró como servicio e interés público a las telecomunicaciones, lo que la oposición rechazó por considerar que viola la Constitución y cercena los derechos económicos de los venezolanos.
La Reforma de la Ley Orgánica de Telecomunicaciones fue aprobada por la amplia mayoría oficialista de la Asamblea Nacional (AN), de 167 miembros, y con los votos negativos de la bancada opositora, integrada por una docena de diputados ex aliados del Gobierno del presidente Hugo Chávez.
El artículo 5 de la norma señala que se declaran servicio e interés público el establecimiento o explotación de redes de telecomunicaciones, la prestación de servicios de telecomunicaciones, radio, televisión y producción nacional audiovisual.
El diputado Juan José Molina, del opositor partido Podemos (izquierda), dijo que esa declaración buscaría facilitarle el camino al Gobierno a la hora de cancelar el permiso legal para operar a una radio o una televisión que incurra en algún error o se vea involucrado en una denuncia.
" El artículo 108 de la Constitución establece de manera clara que el Estado lo que tiene es que garantizar el servicio público, no declarar como tal, ese artículo es violatorio de la Constitución" , afirmó Molina.
Otro punto criticable de la reforma legal, afirmó Molina, es que establece que ninguna persona natural o jurídica podrá obtener en concesión o controlar más de una radio en una misma banda de frecuencia, lo que viola el derecho a la libre empresa.
En la modificación a la Ley de Telecomunicaciones fue eliminado además el artículo que creaba un punto único de acceso a Internet, el mismo que generó gran polémica y fue objeto de denuncias por parte de la oposición, que habló y denunció del establecimiento de un mecanismo de censura.
Se mantiene en la normativa que el Estado venezolano es el administrador del espacio radioeléctrico, y que para su explotación se requiere una habilitación o permiso que antes podía ser de un máximo de 25 años pero que la reforma redujo a 15 años, aunque renovables. (EFE) Cambios en solo 30 días La Asamblea Nacional (AN) de Venezuela se declaró en sesión especial casi un mes antes de que se instalen los nuevos legisladores de su país, emanado de las urnas el pasado septiembre, en el cual el partido de Hugo Chávez gozará de una mayoría simple, aunque no de la calificada necesaria para aprobar leyes orgánicas o poderes especiales para el Ejecutivo. (EFE) ... Ver mas

description.hltext_display: What If Your Running Coach Was a DJ? New iPhone/iPod touch App
description.content:
Tweet uses the accelerometer in the iPhone or iPod touch to measure the rate at which each foot comes in contact with the ground, while beats-per-minute data for each song in the user?s music library is automatically loaded into the app through his or her G3 or wifi connection. The song titles are then matched to a proprietary database where beats-per-minute data is maintained for nearly 10 million songs.
Sacramento, California ? By matching a song?s beats per minute with the runner?s steps per minute, fuses technology and fitness to create a dynamic training experience, improve your performance, and maximize your workout. The app also includes three coached workouts from world class running coaches, providing the option of personal training sessions on demand. Available for the iPhone and iPod touch, the new app is available on the iTunes App Store for $2.99. uses the accelerometer in the iPhone or iPod touch to measure the rate at which each foot comes in contact with the ground, while beats-per-minute data for each song in the user?s music library is automatically loaded into the app through his or her G3 or wifi connection. The song titles are then matched to a proprietary database where beats-per-minute data is maintained for nearly 10 million songs. Within a runner?s first few strides, calculates the current steps-per-minute rate and plays songs with corresponding tempos. When the running tempo increases, a faster song plays; when the tempo slows, the music automatically transitions to a slower song.
Taking personal motivation even further, also includes guided workouts by world class running coaches. These ?Coached Workouts? incorporate voice instruction and music from the user?s playlist to create a personalized training session. The music corresponds directly to the coach?s prompts. If the coach instructs an increase in pace at a specific effort level, the music tempo will then increase to a song with a beats-per-minute equal to that level. Sensitivity settings in the app can be set automatically or manually, allowing each coached workout to be customized to the user?s pace. Science backs the many advantages of fusing fitness and technology. According to Costas Karageorghis and David-Lee Priest of Brunel University (?Music in Sport and Exercise: an Update on Research and Application,? The Sport Journal, 2008) music affects an athlete?s performance in five primary ways: dissociation, arousal regulation, synchronization, acquisition of motor skills, and attainment of flow. Karageorghis and Priest found that music synchronized to workout tempo increased endurance by 15 percent.
The idea for Upbeat Workouts came to running and Ironman triathlon legend Sally Edwards, founder and CEO of Upbeat Workouts Apps, when her training partner Bob Crowley was training for ultra-marathons. He described the problem of having to flip through his music library to find songs that matched his desired pace. Sally experienced and understood his problem.
Sally started running to music with her trusty yellow Sony Walkman in 1984 when she was training for the Olympic Marathon Trials. Since then, she has been using different music-playing devices while training for her many athletic accomplishments, which include winning the Western States 100-Mile Run, finishing 16 Ironman triathlons, and being named the national spokeswoman for the Trek Women Triathlon Series. ?Upbeat has completely changed my training runs from just noise in my ear to music that motivates me,? says Ellen Hall, a runner from Boulder, Colorado. As Ellen explains, now everyone with an iPhone or an iPod touch can ?get motivated and have more fun as the Upbeat Workouts app matches your stride tempo with your taste and tempo of music. Perfect. Simple. Finally.? An app that helps you make the most of your workout by making your music library work for you? Now that?s an idea you can run with.
Device Requirements: * iPhone, iPod touch, and iPad * Requires iOS 3.0 or later * 9.9 MB
Pricing and Availability: 1.0.1 is $2.99 USD (or equivalent amount in other currencies) and available worldwide exclusively through the App Store in the Healthcare & Fitness category. : http://www.thesallyedwardscompany.com/ 1.0.1: http://www.upbeatworkouts.com Purchase and Download: http://itunes.apple.com/app/id373346993 YouTube Video: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ur22NuPbHfs Comstock Magazine Article: http://www.comstocksmag.com/Articles/1210_SR_Nonprofit-Revenue.aspx App Icon: http://a1.phobos.apple.com/us/r1000/007/Purple/6a/6a/89/mzi.zsvekcpi.175�175-75.jpg The company, Upbeat Workouts Apps, was founded by entrepreneur, ultra-marathoner, and triathlete legend, Sally Edwards, as part of her life?s mission to help get America fit. All net proceeds from the sale of her workouts (99 cents) are donated to the Positive Coaching Alliance. Sally is the founder of FLEET FEET Sports and is the past winner of the Western States 100-Miler and the master?s division of the Ironman Triathlon, has competed in multiple adventure races and the RAAM (Race Across AMerica), and is the CEO of Heart Zones USA and , a professional speaking business. All three of her companies are headquartered in Sacramento, CA. Copyright (C) 2010 Upbeat Workouts Apps. All Rights Reserved. Apple, the Apple logo, iPhone, iPod and iPad are registered trademarks of Apple Inc. in the U.S. and/or other countries.
###

description.hltext_display: The9 frames USD100 mln joint fund to invest in MI sector
Nissan turns over first Leaf electric car to Nashville family
description.content:
Nissan handed over the keys to the first Tennessee buyer of its new Leaf at a Nashville dealership on Tuesday, bringing to fruition a multibillion-dollar push to become the world's first automaker to introduce a mass-market, highway-capable electric car. That effort includes a $1 billion lithium-ion battery plant Nissan is building at its Smyrna manufacturing complex, which will start assembling the Leaf sometime in 2012, providing up to 1,300 new jobs here.
The Leaf, which has no tailpipe, and therefore no tailpipe emissions, is intended to usher in an era in which vehicles don't rely directly on imported or domestic oil to run, although there remains some controversy over Nissan's claim that the Leaf produces no emissions.
In Tennessee its emissions are just transferred from the rear of the car to the top of the smokestacks of TVA coal-fired power plants to produce the power to charge the Leaf's battery, some argue.
Jeff and Ashley Heeren of Nashville were the first to receive a Leaf in Tennessee by virtue of being the first to sign up to buy one on a Nissan website in August, said Mark Perry, the Nissan product planner overseeing the Leaf program for Franklin-based Nissan North America Inc.
They picked up the car at Action Nissan, amid a media circus that included film crews from as far away as California. There are lots of other people lined up waiting to get the Leaf, which for now is being sold only in Tennessee and four other states: Washington, Oregon, California and Arizona. Texas and Hawaii will be added in January.
First buyers are 'green'
As for the Heerens, they were eager to become "early adopters" of electric cars, Ashley Heeren said, in part because she works for the Tennessee Parks & Greenways Foundation, which advocates for environmental causes.
"We like to be the first people on the block to get new technology," she said. "We're thrilled to get the first Leaf. The vehicle is phenomenal and very spacious inside."
Just how happy they'll be with the car in the long term remains to be seen, as critics are quick to point out its biggest limitation: It can go only about 100 miles before the lithium-ion battery needs to be recharged, a process that can take as long as eight hours. (2 of 2)"We live in a little seven-mile bubble in Nashville and rarely go outside that, so we don't expect the range to be a problem," Heeren said. "We have installed a charger in our garage. And we do have other cars in the family to use when we take trips." Her other vehicle is perhaps the antithesis of the electric car.
It's a Mercedes-Benz SUV that gets an average of 15 mpg around town, or about one-seventh of the Leaf's 99 mpg-equivalent rating from the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency.
"I think we'll probably be getting rid of the Mercedes pretty soon," she said. "We're thinking of a hybrid SUV of some kind, but we do need the extra space of an SUV for trips."
The couple has two elementary school-age boys.
The Heerens still are trying to figure out how they'll be able to get from Nashville to their weekend home in Monteagle in the Leaf, a drive that probably just barely exceeds the car's range. The town is on Monteagle Mountain along Interstate 24 southeast of Nashville.
"My dad and brother live in Murfreesboro and are buying Leafs as well, so they will have chargers in their garages," Ashley Heeren said. "Maybe we can stop there on the way to Monteagle and back to recharge."
Home chargers such as the ones the Heerens and their relatives will have take seven or eight hours to charge the Leaf's battery. But help is coming sometime next summer in the way of 30-minute fast chargers that will be installed at Cracker Barrel Old Country Store locations and other places, such as some convenience stores, along the interstates between Nashville, Chattanooga and Knoxville.
One of those could give the Heerens a good spot to take a break on the drive to Monteagle, she said.
When asked on Tuesday, Nissan was unable to provide a list of exactly where and when fast charging stations will be online in Tennessee.
Jeff Heeren, an entrepreneur involved in high-tech businesses, said his main interest in the Leaf was its technology.
"I'm an early adopter, and it's a cool vehicle," he said. "Just test driving it before we took delivery, we were getting lots of oddball stares. It's something new and different."
Ashley Heeren said they've already put in an order for a second Leaf, which probably will replace their third vehicle, a Cadillac CTS sedan.
But Nissan's Perry said they'll have to wait before they can get delivery of a second Leaf, at least until all of those who've already signed up get their first ones. "We have a lot of people waiting," he said.

description.hltext_display: Man and boy killed in house blaze
description.content:
A man and a young boy have died after a house fire caused by a chip pan left unattended on a cooker, emergency services said.
West Midlands Ambulance Service said both victims were confirmed dead shortly after their arrival at hospital following the blaze in the Lower Stoke area of Coventry.
An ambulance service spokesman said three ambulances and a paramedic officer were sent to the property in Hollis Road after several 999 calls.
The spokesman said: "On arrival, firefighters were bringing the two patients out of the smoke-filled house.
"As further crews were only seconds away, the first (crew to arrive) decided to leave the scene immediately with the child to take him to University Hospital in Coventry.
"While the crew worked on the child, a firefighter drove the ambulance."
Both victims were in cardiac arrest when they were rescued from the two-storey terrace house and fire crews also attempted to resuscitate the adult victim.
The ambulance service spokesman said the second crew to arrive immediately took over efforts to revive the man before taking him to the same hospital.
"Sadly, despite the best efforts of fire, ambulance and hospital staff, it was not possible to save either the man or the boy and they were both confirmed dead shortly after arrival at hospital," the spokesman said.

description.hltext_display: Fifth candidate files for Decatur council, primary needed
Fidel (coração) Obama
description.content:
Consta que o grafite vem se reproduzindo nas paredes de Cuba e dos Estados Unidos. Conhecemos demais. Eu (coraçãozinho) Tal Coisa.
Há talvez um excesso de paz na Terra aos homens de boa - e também de má - vontade.
Em Cuba, e já se espalha pela América Latina, Yo (corazonzito) Obama.
E seu reverso ou consequência vem sofrendo campanha por norte-americanos que não desejam a extradição ou a morte do assanhado antípoda Julian Assange: I (little heart) Fidel.
Quem te viu e quem te vê, hein, Fidel? Aguentou firme invasão de Kennedy, charutos explosivos da CIA, viu passarem, ou melhor desfilarem desta para melhor (possivelmente pior), 10 presidentes dos Estados Unidos. Unidos, sejamos claros, em desejar, se não tramar, o assassinato do jefe máximo cubano, ora contando 84 anitos: o equivalente, mais ou menos, de generais de pijamas.
Ao que parece, há em Havana um destacamento militar encarregado de, lá pelas 11 da manhã, botar Fidel numa cadeirinha de lona e deixá-lo exposto aos saudáveis raios da ilha caribenha.
Um segundo destacamento, por volta de 1 da tarde, recolhe-o - limpa a babinha que escorreu do canto esquerdo da boca desenhando um mapa da ilha na gola do pijama, e o leva para desfrutar dos prazeres da culinária cubana. Sopinha de feijão preto e broinha de fubá El Mimoso é sua refeição predileta.
Depois, uma siesta, que ninguém nessa idade é de ferro, mesmo tendo passado pelos rigores de Sierra Maestra.
Lá vai o grande Fidel a caminho da rede cantando os poucos compassos que, ao longo de uma vida, conseguiu decorar de Guantanamera. Não é nenhum Pete Seeger mas dá, aqui e ali, umas notinhas quase, quase afinadas. No fundo, no fundo, Fidel preferia ouvir Bola de Nieve cantando Drume Negrita.
À espera do sono benévolo da tarde quente e preguiçosa de Havana, um soldado de voz macia e musical lê para ele uma seleção especial dos noticiários nacional e internacional especialmente preparada para ele por equivalentes ao que há de melhor em mestres-cucas cubanos.
Corre, à boca pequena, e grande também, que cada vez que é mencionado o nome de Barack Obama, Fidel abre os olhões sonolentos e, em sua melhor dicção cubana, pergunta e pede, "Cumequié? Obama? Lê de novo. Caprichando,"
É o que afirmam serviços de inteligência locais e também os sediados em Little Havana, em Miami, estado da Flórida, EUA.
Os jornais estão dando.
Assange, ora muito vedete, aguarda pressuroso mais novidades para poder vazar. (Assange tem a alma das colunistas de mexericos dos tablóides.)
Tudo indica que a idade não é motivo para Fidel se aposentar das folganças amorosas. Uma notícia de última hora, divulgada ainda agorinha pela WikiLeaks, revela que, por telegramas, a diplomacia do Tio Sam está prestes a parir uma abóbora de tão preocupada.
Estavam eles, os diplomatas americanos, a divulgar, também lá de suas siestas, a mais recente diatribe do líder máximo, decano dos ditadores. De repente, a zebra.
Fidel, em sua empreitada autobiográfica-jornalística, a Reflexiones del Compañero Fidel, elogiando Obama. Elogiando mesmo.
Uma loucura de azeitonas no empadão americano.
E fazendo apologias para quem o visita (só entre as 4 e 6 da tarde) das qualidades ímpares e pares do presidente americano.
O nobelizado líder pacífico americano (está ultimando a venda recorde de 96 bilhões de dólares em armamentos para a Arábia Saudita), em 9 de junho, no Cairo, discursou sobre as relações entre seu país e os muçulmanos.
Fidel não teve dúvida: enviou uma mensagem congratulatória de 3.500 palavras, média que ele reserva apenas para os cartões de Natal e Feliz Ano Novo.
Um diplomata americano, anônimo nesta coluna ao menos (não vazamos), foi longe e disse que assim não dava pé, virara obsessão. Sem erro de ortografia e concordância, o que é raro para os americanos nomeados embaixadores, já que não são de carreira mas apenas ricos contribuintes para campanhas eleitorais.
"Grande comunicador!", dizia Fidel, durante todo aquele junho, de sua cadeirinha de lona exposta ao sol, e a guarda cuidava de que nenhum passante o ouvisse. "Grande comunicador!", repetia Fidel, como se referindo a um Chacrinha ou Sílvio Santos.
Nada mais dissemelhante do que o "bêbado homicida" que, até outro dia mesmo - e parece que foi ontem - reservava para George W. Bush.
Apesar de não ter aprovado de todo o desempenho de Obama na conferência sobre mudanças climáticas em Copenhague (chamou-o de "beirando o demagogo"), Fidel Castro ainda não pune com prisão ou fuzilamento quem espalhar o grafite em questão, o do coraçãozinho, pelos muros e postes da cidade.
Línguas maldosas chegam a dizer que o próprio Fidel Castro rabisca os grafites num caderninho de capa azul onde anota pensamentos para suas "reflexiones" e faz caricaturas de inimigos que já se foram.

description.hltext_display: Felipao cierra el año como goleador y figura del Levante
description.content:
Futbolistas legionarios El ecuatoriano Felipe Caicedo cerró un buen año en el Levante español, donde es el máximo goleador (siete tantos) y uno de los mejores jugadores de su equipo.
La campaña de Felipao es muy buena al termino de 2010. El atacante tricolor logró marcar el transitorio empate en la jornada q ue se cumplió el fin de semana anterior frente al Athletic de Bilbao en la derrota de su equipo en casa (1-2) por la 16.ª fecha de la liga española de fútbol.
Su fortaleza física, su buen dominio de balón y su olfato goleador hacen de Caicedo una de la principales armas ofensivas del Levante en la presente temporada.
Su presencia goleadora y su certera definición frente al arco rival lo han convertido en uno de los jugadores mimados por la hinchada del conjunto español.
Caicedo jugó 12 partidos con su equipo y marcó siete goles, lo que le deja un promedio de efectividad de 0,58 goles por partido. Los 654 minutos en los que actuó el ecuatoriano le convierten en uno de los que más tiempo acumuló en cancha para el Levante en la presente temporada liguera.
Sus inicios en el Basilea suizo le permitieron despuntar en la liga de este país y dar el gran salto a la Premier League, donde no tuvo una buena temporada con el Manchester City, que sin embargo le sirvieron para que el Sporting de Lisboa portugués ponga sus ojos sobre él. A sus cortos 22 años, Caicedo ha demostrado sus dotes goleadores y ahora se ha mantenido un par de temporadas en otra de las ligas más importantes del planeta, la española.
En el Málaga y ahora en el Levante, el delantero tricolor parece haber encontrado su madurez futbolística y la efectividad en la definición, algo primordial para que un delantero pueda marcar la diferencia en una liga tan competitiva como la ibérica.
Sus goles han emocionado a la afición levantina y han logrado que otro de los grandes del continente europeo como el Bayern Múnich alemán muestre su interés por contar con el ecuatoriano para la próxima temporada.
Caicedo quiere cerrar con broche de oro el año marcando un gol hoy frente al Real Madrid en el partido de ida por los octavos de final de la Copa del Rey en el estadio Santiago Bernabéu.
Sin embargo, sus actuaciones y sus goles con el Levante no le han permitido llegar a la Selección, ya que Reinaldo Rueda (DT) no lo ha convocado en el nuevo proceso que inició en septiembre pasado. (GV) Cascaritas El partido entre el Real Madrid vs. Levante por la Copa del Rey se juega hoy, a las 14:00.
El capitán del Levante, Miquel Robusté, dijo que buscarán dar "la sorpresa" en el partido frente al Madrid.
Felipe Caicedo es el máximo goleador del Levante con siete tantos. ... Ver mas

description.hltext_display: CDC Software (CDCS.NASDAQ) announces OEM partnership with OnAsset
9 new stores by March for cosmetics maker
description.content:
Sa Sa International Holdings Ltd, Asia's largest cosmetics retailer, plans to step up its expan-sion on the Chinese mainland, which is expected to become its key growth driver.
The mainland market will be a priority for Sa Sa in the next two years, with outlets expected to number 32 by March, and 100 in two to three years, Sa Sa's spokeswoman Macy Leung told the Global Times Tuesday.
Hong Kong-based Sa Sa currently has 23 retail outlets on the Chinese mainland, according to Leung.
Market watchers said the move is aimed at boosting market share in the lucrative mainland market, where Sa Sa has so far struggled to turn a profit.
Sa Sa has a much smaller share of the mainland cosmetics retail market than Watsons and Sephora, said Feng Jianjun, a cosmetics marketing expert.
"The firm's sweeping success in Hong Kong cannot be easily transplanted into the mainland market. While many Sa Sa brands are high-profile in the US and Europe, they are not well-known on the mainland," Feng said, pointing out that mainland consumers prefer heavily advertised brands. Sa Sa also loses points because of its high prices, he added.
The firm's mainland sales grew 42.1 percent to reach HK$60 million ($7.72 million) for the six months ended 30 September 2010, but it is still in the red, according to its interim results released November.
"The Group has decided to switch its strategic priority in this market (mainland market) from time to breakeven to faster network expansion," it said in the interim results statement.
"Our number one priority in the mainland is to accelerate our network expansion," Chairman and CEO Kwok Siu-ming said in the statement. "We will open more stores in existing cities to increase market penetration and enter new cities within our current operating areas."
Analysts noted that online business would be a key market trend in the future, with hot competition over online cosmetics sales.
Online retail will surge at the expense of the brick and mortar business, which is constrained by rising rental and labor costs, said Si Wei, an analyst with Cinda Securities Co.
Feng believes online sales will give Sa Sa an opportunity to add glitter and boost market penetration.
Sa Sa will reportedly launch a website for mainland consumers in the near future.
Shares in Sa Sa jumped 6.5 percent to HK$4.89 ($0.63) Tuesday.

description.hltext_display: 上半年网络诈骗超120亿 钓鱼网站全国超10万家
description.content:
中国IDC评述网12月20日报道：昨天，央视《每周质量报告》报道，目前欺诈类的钓鱼网站全国已超过10万家。2009年，仅北京警方就接报网络诈骗案件3700多起，网络诈骗金额达7000多万元。有专家认为，今年上半年，网络诈骗给网民和社会带来的直接与间接经济损失已超过了120亿元。
“中奖”三万八 骗走两万九
四川省内江市的何先生前不久上网时，电脑突然弹出信息，告知何先生中奖了38000元现金和一台笔记本电脑。喜出望外的何先生立即登陆中奖信息上的网址，并通过电话确认。但领取奖品的前提是先付1200元现金。一心想得到奖品的何先生随后在对方一步步的指引下不断地汇去现金，总共汇出了29000元。到最后何先生才意识到，自己受骗了。
据公安部门介绍，像这样的诈骗是近些年电信诈骗中的一种新形式网络中奖诈骗。据北京反电信诈骗专项行动办公室副主任马曦初介绍，“这些骗子就是利用了老百姓的侥幸心理。就是这种求财心理，使消费者放松了对自己财务的控制权，轻易就相信对方的一些诱惑因素，最后上当受骗。”
网购陷阱花样多
记者在调查中发现，利用网络通道，不法分子还经常打着低价、优惠等幌子实施诈骗，而这些网络诈骗陷阱往往让消费者防不胜防。
记者以购买手机的名义，进行了一次网络购物体验。在输入了商品名称并进行搜索后，电脑页面出现了一万多条卖家信息。记者选取了排在第一位的商家，发现该商家有着很高的信用等级，手机的价格也比市场价便宜500多元。记者随即点击了购买按键。
之后，网页跳转到了网上银行付款页面。网络安全人员说，这是一个钓鱼网站，淘宝网网页是假的。网络安全专家解释说，正常的淘宝网络购物，应该把钱汇入到支付宝中，再由淘宝网付给卖家。而记者遇到的所谓淘宝卖家，则是通过假的淘宝网页，引导记者把钱直接汇给个人，以这种方式诈骗钱财。
推荐股票成网络诈骗新方向
网络购物陷阱的存在使消费者的财产安全受到了极大威胁。而网络陷阱还不仅限于网络购物这一种，一些打着彩票预测、推荐股票名义的网络陷阱也在威胁着消费者。

description.hltext_display: Special Report: Inside AIG's tortuous turnaround
Romania fumes at Franco-German Schengen blockade
description.content:
Romanian President Traian Basescu lashed out at a decision by France and Germany yesterday (21 December) to postpone his country’s accession to the EU's border-free Schengen area, describing it as an act of "discrimination". The EurActiv network reports from Bucharest and Sofia.
Background
Schengen is a village at the border between Luxembourg, France and Germany, where an agreement was signed in 1985 to gradually abolish checks at common borders between those countries, the Netherlands and Belgium.
Gradually, the process was taken further. In 1995, border controls were abolished between Belgium, Germany, France, Luxembourg, the Netherlands, Spain and Portugal.
Today, the Schengen border-free area consists of 25 member states: 22 EU countries (all except Bulgaria, Romania, Ireland, the UK and Cyprus) as well as three associated countries: Norway, Iceland and Switzerland. Denmark has signed the Schengen agreement, but has kept its freedom not to apply certain measures.
The UK and Ireland decided to stay outside the Schengen area.
Romaniaand Bulgaria, which joined the EU in 2007, remain outside the agreement due to shortcomings in their police and judicial systems. Both countries were placed under a special monitoring system, called a Cooperation and Verification Mechanism.
In September, EU ministers for European Affairs decided to extend the monitoring for another year.
More on this topic
News:Romania, Bulgaria’s presidents push for Schengen accession
News:Romania could enter Schengen 'if EU shuts one eye'
Speaking in the presidential palace in Bucharest, Basescu said his country would not accept discrimination from anyone, "be it from the most powerful countries of the EU".
Hours before, the interior ministers of France and Germany, Brice Hortefeux and Thomas de Maizière, had issued a joint letter saying they would block Romania and Bulgaria's Schengen bid.
According to the two ministers, not all conditions are met for the two countries to join the Schengen border-free area.
The two countries had initially planned to join the passport-free zone in March 2011.
"It would not be realistic nor responsible to neglect the deficiencies identified," says the letter, seen by EurActiv Romania. Among the deficiencies, the ministers specify "the absence of a satisfactory juridical and administrative environment in the fields of security and justice, persisting corruption at different levels and worrying levels of organised crime".
Consequently, the ministers plead for a postponement of Romania and Bulgaria’s Schengen accession for a later date.
"We consider that the decision should be taken when the main causes of worries would be removed and when the two countries would begin irreversible progress in their fight against corruption, of organised crime, as well as of reforming their judicial systems," the letter reads.
Moving target?
When Romania and Bulgaria joined the EU in 2007, they were placed under a special monitoring mechanism to assist them in reforming their juridical systems and combat corruption. In the case of Bulgaria, the fight against organised crime was highlighted as a particular problem. Since then regular reports have revealed only limited progress.
However, the European Commission admits that there is no legal link between the Bulgaria and Romania's progress under the mechanism and their accession to the Schengen area.
In his statement, Basescu said that Romania had met all technical requirements for joining Schengen and would not accept the introduction of "additional conditionalities".
A Polish diplomat told EurActiv recently that his country was worried by attempts from older EU members to "change the rules" of the game and adopt "moving targets" that are difficult to be achieve for newcomers, citing Romania and Bulgaria's Schengen bid as a case in point.
The diplomat also expressed worried that the permanent safety net for the euro zone could to raise the bar higher for countries that wish to adopt the common currency.
Retribution for the Roma invasion?
The push by Paris can also be seen as an act of reprisal against the massive arrival of Romas to France. The expulsion of those migrants, who were mostly from Romania, has stirred unprecedented controversy and criticism from the European Commission.
French European Affairs Minister Laurent Wauquiez recently saidthat "Romania and Bulgaria do not have a closed door," but explained that those countries were simply unable to secure their own borders.
Bulgaria remains silent
As with the Roma controversy, Sofia chose to keep a low profile, after the French-German letter became public. Over the last months, the country's Prime Minister Boyko Borissov deliberately choose not to criticise Paris for its expulsions of Bulgarian Roma, hoping that in exchange, France would not veto his country's Schengen bid.
The only official reaction so far comes from a spokesperson of the Bulgarian Foreign Ministry, who said Sofia would redouble efforts to reform its judiciary and convince doubters that it has made progress.
Meanwhile, the public uproar in Bulgarian and Romania appears to be massive. Hundreds of readers have commented under the article by Dnevnik, EurActiv's sister publication in Bulgaria, which carried the news of their countries' rejected Schengen bid. Many comments see it as a setback for Bulgaria's Prime Minister, who had made Schengen accession his biggest EU priority.

description.hltext_display: Iconic American choreographer in Moscow
description.content: Wednesday will see the first night of prominent American choreographer William Forsythe’s Herman Schmerman in the Moscow Bolshoi Theater, an event that critics said is all but certain to make a splash among theatergoers. Also on Wednesday, world ballet icon George Balanchine’s Rubies and Serenade are expected to hit the stage at Bolshoi.

石家庄女网友创办民间公益网站反色情网
description.content:
http://www.idcps.com2010-12-20 09:11:49 燕赵都市网 关注度(194) 我要报料 进入论坛
中国反色情网首页截图
中国IDC评述网12月20日报道：最近，全国首家旗帜鲜明地反对色情的民间公益网站在石家庄成立运营，并迅速走红网络。据了解，主办该网站的志愿者大部分是石家庄人，其中有一半多为女士，她们用亲身经历讲述色情带来的害处，唤醒人们珍爱自己，珍视家庭。
搜色情却登录反色情网
近日，某大学学生小张向本报记者讲述了自己搜索色情网站反而登陆反色情网的经历。
最近，适逢全国又展开进一步网络扫黄运动，小张发现，原先他们经常进的色情网站，都打不开了。小张在百度上搜索“色情”等关键词，竟然进入“中国反色情网”。百无聊赖中，他开始阅读该网站“淫乱恶果”“性与健康”“清心园”“智慧树”等栏目的文章。“读后感觉触目惊心，没想到迷恋色情会产生这么多恶果。”小张说，“很多犯错的人都像我这样自以为已经具备自控能力的成年人，真的遇到事情后，反倒很冲动。”
两年前，小张在某网站上读到一篇《手淫无害论》的文章，从此他沾染了手淫恶习，越陷越深。“偶尔手淫一次或许没事，但成瘾以后，对我的身体伤害很大，以前踢足球我能跑完整场，现在半小时都坚持不下来。”小张说，自从他读了中国反色情网一些文章后，他戒掉了手淫的习惯。
后来小张发现，主办该网站的志愿者大部分是石家庄人，于是，他与这些志愿者取得联系，成为其中一员，在学校宣传色情泛滥给人带来的危害。
创办网站意图警示
昨日，记者登陆中国反色情网（http：//www.haongo.com）,发现这家刚运营不久的网站竟然很有规模，其中包括“忏悔台”“淫乱恶果”“告别婚外恋”“婚姻家庭”“性与健康”“举报黄网”等二十几个栏目，最高的帖子点击次数达5000余次。
网站创始人之一子明女士介绍，创办这个网站的想法由来已久，因为身在媒体，她了解了太多的色情泛滥的现状和危害，有太多的孩子、家庭因为错误的色情观念导致了祸害。
让她震惊的是，一次自己上幼儿园的女儿跟她说：“妈妈，我要和班里的某某好……”子明说，女儿一些不堪入耳的话让她很震惊，现在社会对情色信息的泛滥已经司空见惯，看看高校周围，到处都是日租房，公共厕所墙壁上到处是无痛人流广告……但这一切的恶果是，每年有数万少女堕胎，离婚率急剧攀升……
志愿者英子介绍，她以前有一个幸福的家庭，后来老公因为业务原因经常出入一些不健康的场所，发生了婚外性行为，染上性病，导致家庭破裂。“经过两年多的煎熬，我已经从婚姻失败中走出来了，但我年仅14岁的儿子却因我们离婚，性格变得异常压抑，甚至还有暴力倾向。”英子说。
英子说，身边有太多这样的例子，夫妻因为婚外性行为离婚了，使孩子失去了正常的家庭环境，成了问题孩子，进而成为社会问题。
志愿者夏昕此前多年一直做义务教育工作，许多问题孩子在她的帮助下得到了好转。她说，一个未成年女孩去医院做人流，后面跟来了三个男青年，而女孩一点羞耻感都没有。这说明社会上关于性观念的导向出了问题。
“尽管有关部门一再严厉打击色情网站，但许多门户网站为了追求点击率，却允许色情信息大行其道。”夏昕说，“一个孩子陷入色情信息诱惑的海洋，会有健康的身体和人格吗？会有幸福的婚姻和人生吗？几乎是不可能的。”
因为在网上搜索没有看到过民间发起的公益反色情网站，因此从2010年10月初开始，他们和石家庄十名通过网络认识的网友相约，共同商量建立中国反色情网。他们筹钱7000多元，租赁了服务器，并找专业人士设计了网页。很快在10月底，中国反色情网正式上线，以此唤醒人们珍爱自己，珍视家庭。

description.hltext_display: Tesco Bank Partners With Blackhawk Network to Deliver Gift Cards to Tesco Customers
Extraordinary number on BCS title game
description.author: Harry King
description.content:
LITTLE ROCK — The over-under number for total points scored in the BCS title game is something straight out of Conference USA where, it seems, defense is frowned upon.
Jay Rood, race and sports book director for MGM Resorts International in Las Vegas, remembered putting up 76 a few weeks ago. It probably involved Tulsa, he said, or East Carolina.
That sounds right. After all, Tulsa gave up 50 in a winning effort and scored 49 in a loss. East Carolina scored 38 twice and 35 twice and lost all four games.
The number for No. 1 vs. No. 2 is 74 1/2. Something in the 70s usually denotes spread teams with struggling defenses, but this is Auburn of the Southeastern Conference vs. Oregon of the Pac-10.
“It looks ridiculously high in a BCS championship game,” Rood said in a phone interview.
Rood said the number is about 20 points higher than he posted last January when Alabama’s defense was too much for Texas without Colt McCoy, 37-21.
Rood has done his job, posting a total that will attract bettors on both sides of the proposition. Oregon is No. 1 in scoring and Auburn is No. 6. Add their averages of 49.33 and 42.69 points per game and the over is easy money.
Not so fast. All it takes is one team to put together a 10- or 11-play drive that consumes several minutes.
“I would not be completely taken aback, not to say the coaches are going to re-invent the wheel, but they might take a little bit different tact than what got them there,” Rood said. “They have so much time on their hands, they might draw up and tear up and throw away 10 or 15 game plans.”
That said, Rood can middle with the best of them.
“The hinges could come unhooked and there be 30 points in a quarter,” he said. “I don’t think playing the under will be safe at any point.”
In Little Rock recently, former Arkansas coach Frank Broyles talked about the offensive explosion in football. Speed is the key, he said, and it could be cyclical as it was years ago when the wishbone was the rage and Oklahoma led the nation in scoring in 1971 with 45 points per game. Eventually, coaches figured out that discipline on defense was the answer and the wishbone all but vanished.
The spread offense, Broyles said, forces people to defend the width and length of the field. In turn, one missed tackle means a gain of 15 yards or more.
The over-under is 15 to 20 points higher on the title game than it is on most of the other BCS games. For instance, Arkansas-Ohio State in the Sugar Bowl is around 58. And, those are not two stick-in-the-mud offenses. Ohio State is No. 11 in the country in scoring and Arkansas is No. 16.
Despite Ohio State’s 0-9 record against SEC teams, Rood established the Buckeyes as a field goal favorite. One of his reference points is Ohio State’s 26-17 victory over Oregon in the 2010 Rose Bowl.
“The Oregon team they faced last year is close to what they are going to face in an SEC opponent,” he said. “Oregon is as close to the SEC as you can get with speed and very tactical play calling.” ??- Harry King is sports columnist for Stephens Media’s Arkansas News Bureau. His e-mail address is hking@arkansasnews.com.

description.hltext_display: Foodies fight with film school for space in LA
description.content:
LOS ANGELES -- For a few weeks this month, Los Angeles' arugula-munching set confronted a threat that seemed as potent as any malicious insect, pathogen or pesticide-tainted produce.
Where would they get their lovingly grown, locally sourced fruits, vegetables and artisanal edibles if a parking dispute with an adjacent film school forced the Hollywood Farmers Market to move or close?
The Los Angeles Film School, which has held classes in its nine-story Sunset Boulevard building since 1999, had refused to sign off on a permit for the Sunday farmers market because it blocks an entryway into a lot where the school's growing number of students park.
At the root of the conflict were some of the city's sacred mainstays: deep agricultural ties, the entertainment business and a lack of parking in a town dominated by cars.
Even as a temporary accord last week put the threat on hold, the foodie furor offered a peek at how dependent some have become on the Hollywood market, among the largest in the region, and the smaller markets it supports in low-income communities.
While consumer demand has encouraged farmers markets to sprout like Portobello mushrooms across the U.S., the attachment to just-picked produce and those who grow it appears particularly intense in Los Angeles, seated in a county that less than a century ago was the nation's leading agricultural producer.
"When you're talking about growers and shoppers being able to complete the exchange directly, it has a lot of resonance," cookbook author and food writer Amelia Saltsman said.
The Los Angeles Film School recently added computer animation and video game production to its curricula of film and recording arts, more than doubling the size of its student body from 750 to 1,700, spokesman Antoine Ibrahim said.
The growing population has increased demand for parking spots on Sundays, when throngs of students flood the school's labs and studios, Ibrahim said. The school also plans to begin holding classes on Sundays to relieve increasing weekday class sizes, he said.
Ibrahim insisted that the school never meant for the market to be shut down. It just wanted the vendors blocking the lot to be shifted to another part of the market.
"We've always worked with them to compromise and coexist," Ibrahim said. "We don't want them to move."
But the nonprofit Sustainable Economic Enterprises of Los Angeles, which organizes the market, said the configuration being pushed by the school meant it would lose half of its 100 farmers because there wouldn't be enough space for their stalls.

description.hltext_display: Guatemala en estado de sitio
description.content:
Lucha contra el narcotráfico GUATEMALA. El estado de sitio vigente en el estado de Alta Verapaz, en el norte de Guatemala, se mantiene. El presidente Álvaro Colom no descarta ampliarlo a cuatro departamentos más.
El estado que rige desde el domingo pasado para sacar a los carteles de la droga presentes en el país ha dejado hasta el momento 10 personas detenidas bajo sospechas de ser miembros de las bandas de Los Zetas.
Además, unos 300 agentes de la Policía Nacional Civil (PNC) en Alta Verapaz fueron removidos hacia otro destino y quedaron bajo investigación. (EFE) ... Ver mas

description.hltext_display: Lokalbarometern: Färre lediga lokaler utannonseras i Sverige
description.content:
Startsida> Lokalbarometern: Färre lediga lokaler utannonseras. . . Efter ett år av ökat utbud av lediga lokaler kommer nu tecken på att trenden kan ha brutits. Annonsvolymen för kommersiella lokaler har minskat med 3,6 procent sedan den 1 november. Det visar en mätning genomförd av Objektvision.se, Sveriges största marknadsplats för lokaler.
Totalt finns 9698 lediga kommersiella lokaler i Sverige med en yta på strax över 10 miljoner kvadratmeter. I början av november var antalet utannonserade lokaler 10061, vilket innebär att utbudet minskat med 3,6 procent mellan den första november och den 14 december. Fortfarande är antalet lokaler dock 1,2 procent fler än hur det såg ut i januari i år.
- Detta är med största sannolikhet ett tecken på att den förbättrade konjunkturen även slår igenom på fastighetsmarknaden, med minskade vakansgrader, säger Ulf Magnusson, VD på Objektvision.
Endast i Västerbottens och Uppsala län ökar antalet lediga lokaler. I Jämtlands och Norrbottens län ligger nivåerna stilla. Största minskningen sker i Gotlands respektive Kalmar län med 17,9 respektive 16,4 procent, jämfört med den första november.
Flest lediga lokaler finns i Stockholms län och Västra Götalands län, med 3515 respektive 1867 stycken.
Fakta om mätningen:
Mätningen genomfördes den 14 december. Siffrorna jämförs med den 1 november i år samt den 28 januari 2010.
Mätningen omfattar kommersiella lokaler som industrier, verkstäder, kontor, lager/förråd, kontorshotell, som annonseras ut på Objektvision.se, Sveriges största marknadsplats för kommersiella lokaler.
Objektvision kan ta fram specialstatistik på kommunnivå. Hör av er till objektvision@greenhillrelations.se så hjälper vi till.
