description.hltext_display: BERKSHIRE LEAGUE WRESTLING PREVIEW: Depth and experience is a key on the mat (with capsules)
description.content:
In the Berkshire League, composed of Class S-sized schools with a sprinkling of M’s, team numbers are always a factor. It’s especially true in wrestling, with 14 weight classes to fill.
Given enough athletes, even lacking precise fits, quality wrestlers often move up a class or two to fill the gaps. Teams that can fill all 14 slots often begin with a competitive advantage because forfeits cost six points in a match.
So, like other sports, but more so, the most successful BL wrestling programs are those that keep attracting new kids.
The best programs do it by locking them in early with middle school feeder programs or wrestling clubs that start kids earlier.
Year after year, defending champion Nonnewaug fields a bigger team than anyone else. Combined with quality coaching, that also makes the Chiefs a perennial league favorite.
As classy a program as any in the state, Nonnewaug has long served as the model for many BL programs, with a steady rise in the league’s prowess as a result.
Last year, three BL teams finished in the top 10 at the Class S State Tournament. Nonnewaug was second; Thomaston, sixth; Gilbert, ninth. Terryville (11th) and Housatonic (15th) waited just outside in the field of 32.
The Chiefs went on to ninth place in the State Open.
As important as a steady feeder stream is to wrestling teams, graduations can be even more costly than in other sports; in wrestling, experience counts for everything. Continued...
Reader Comments »
View reader comments (0) » Comment on this story »
Speed and strength are important add-ons, but, without experience, newcomers are easily lost in a physical chess game in which the best wrestlers think two moves ahead.
A four-year wrestler isn’t apt to be easily replaced by an underclassmen unless training began in a youth program.
In a strong league last year, everyone lost key wrestlers. Nonnewaug, Thomaston, Terryville and Gilbert, perhaps in that order, are most likely to have people moving up the pipeline to vie for top spots in the league and states.
At the same time, all eight of the area schools that produce wrestlers — Gilbert, Housatonic, Nonnewaug, Northwestern, Terryville, Thomaston, Torrington and Wolcott Tech — are guaranteed to have standout individuals.
A sports that requires numbers for team success remains a battle of single warriors in the spotlight, using wits, experience, speed and strength to dominate, survive or avoid embarrassment.
GILBERT
Coach: Doug Smith, 10th year
Last year: BL Tournament 4th; Class S 9th of 32 teams.
Key losses: Xavier Dubois, 152 Class S 4th; Ross Lopardo 171 BL Champ, Class S runner-up.
Key returners: Josh Hoxie 112/119 sr, Class S and BL 103-pound Champ; Brigitte Smyth 112/119 sr, BL 112-pound runner-up; Andrew Smith 119 soph; Alek Smith 130 sr, BL Champ, Class S 3rd; Sean Blackwell 135 jr; Dylan Jeferies 140 jr, BL 135-pound runner-up; Grant Dziedzic, 140 jr; Jake Minard, 189 soph; Michael Kampartas, 215 soph. Continued...
Reader Comments »
View reader comments (0) » Comment on this story »
Key Newcomers: Ansari Moonis 112 fres; Nick Holland 140 fresh.
Team outlook: Smith has built a solid program at Gilbert, but needs more numbers and experience to surround his all-state caliber seniors.
HOUSATONIC
Coach: Thomas Medonis, 1st year
Last year: 3-12; BL Tournament 7th; Class S 15th of 32 teams.
Key losses: Ryan MacLaren, 171.
Key returners: Dom Ghi 119 sr, Class S 3rd; Conor MacLaren 135 soph; Tyler Spaddacini, 140 soph, BL runner-up; Steve Wingard, 160 jr, BL runner-up, Class S 4th; Dom Sanchez; Kevin Arel; Nameer Abo-Hamzy.
Key newcomers: Zach Wilcox; Hannah Arel.
Team outlook: The Mountaineers have some quality wrestlers to lead them, but, like Gilbert, lack numbers and experience.
NONNEWAUG Continued...
Reader Comments »
View reader comments (0) » Comment on this story »
Coach: Dave Green
Last year: BL Tournament Champs; Class S runners-up; State Open 9th.
Key losses: Andrew Miller 140; Dane Denslow 145, BL runner-up; Jon Hutter 152, Class S 6th; D.J. Hardesty 160, BL Champ, Class S 3rd; Ronnie Walter 285, BL, Class S, State Open Champ.
Key returners: Alex Paparazzo 103 sr, BL runner-up, Class S runner-up; Quentin Mylie, 112 jr; Austin Hodges 119 jr; Tyler Tilbe 125 sr, BL, Class S, State Open Champ; Brian Reilly 130 sr, BL runner-up, Class S 4th; Matt Cucci, 135 jr; Jon Rubano 171 sr; Paul Caisse 189 sr, BL runner-up; Sal Longo 215 jr.
Team outlook: The Chiefs are the BL wrestling standard setters in most years. They have high-quality wrestlers to replace, but the numbers in their program mean someone else finally gets his chance. Nonnewaug will be at or near the top again.
NORTHWESTERN
Coach: Andrew Schwartz, 2nd year
Last year: BL Tournament 6th; Class S 22nd of 32.
Key losses: Shawn Rich 103; Dan McColter 112; Will Kelsey 119; Mike Budny 152 BL Champ.
Key returners: Kyle Smith 125 sr, BL runner-up; Wayne Ibitz 140 soph; Taylor Lewis 160 sr; Nick Hotchkiss 171 jr; Jon Coleman 189 jr; Tim Zeitler 285 sr, BL, Class S runner-up.
Outlook: Coach Schwartz’s enthusiasm has taken his team from seven wrestlers last year to 12 this year. Three seniors, including two BL runners-up, will lead an otherwise young team.
TERRYVILLE
Coach: Peter Veleas
Last year: BL Tournament 3rd; Class S 11th
Key losses: Joe LaCourse 125; Cody Benson 171; John Draper 189, BL Champ, Class S 3rd, State Open 5th
Key returners: Josh Rivard 103 soph; Dan Lupone 112 sr; D.J. Russo 119 sr, BL, Class S runner-up; Ben Russo 130 soph; Dan Blekis 135 sr; Scott LaMarre 140 jr, BL Champ; Dominic Folino 145 sr, BL Champ, Class S 6th; Jay LeGassey 152 jr; Alex Huizenga 160 jr; Aaron Goderre 215 jr.
Outlook: Terryville graduated just three starters, though one of them was a league champion. With what they have left in a strong program, the Kangaroos might be even better this year.
THOMASTON
Coach: Shaun Canney, 1st year
Last year: 14-13; BL Tournament runner-up; Class S 6th.
Key losses: Mike Finer 215, BL Champ; Travis Barstow 130; Aaron Kennedy 145; Jonathan Ozuendo 152;
Key returners: Clifal Aquino, 103 jr, Class S 6th; William Hartle 112 soph; Alan Sanford 119 sr, 3-time BL Champ, 2-time Class S champ; Rigon Gilani 125 soph; Kyle Oldham 135 jr, 2-time BL champ; Sal Santa Maria 160 sr; Mark Dilley 171 sr, BL runner-up, Class S Champ; Tyler Margison 285 jr, Class S 4th.
Key newcomers: Nejad Abo Hamzy 112; Jeff Desautels 135; Mergim Isaku 160.
Team outlook: Like Terryville, the Golden Bears graduated a BL champion, but a successful program allows others to step into the vacant slots. The Bears should join Nonnewaug and Terryville in a three-way battle for the league crown.
TORRINGTON
Coach: Red Raider wrestlers are attached to Wolcott Tech’s program, with training and coaching from the Wildcats.
Key returner: Dean Tsopanides 285 sr, Class L 3rd.
Key newcomer: Chris Parrotta 130 fresh.
Outlook: Tsopanides should vie for the state title this year; Parrotta, a good athlete, faces the same learning curve as all other wrestling newcomers. Torrington wrestlers follow Tech’s schedule; the NVL does not recognize wrestling as one of its sports, nor do the Raiders have team status in the BL.
WOLCOTT TECH
Coach: Brian Colavecchio, 2nd year.
Last year: BL Tournament 5th; Class M 16th of 32.
Key losses: Todd Colitti 112, BL Champ; Adam Lagassie 152, BL runner-up, Class M 6th; Rob Brenckman 160; Steve Spear 189; Dan Fortier 215, BL runner-up; John Blake 285, Class M 4th.
Key returners: Sam Wilson 112 soph; Derrick Lopes 119 sr; Austin Vaillancourt 125 jr; Jason Chamis 135 jr; Dustin Chang 215 soph.
Outlook: Graduation took a heavy toll on last year’s good Wildcat team, but the Colavecchio’s enthusiasm has netted new wrestlers eager to learn. For now, the team is inexperienced and could still use more numbers.
Reader Comments »
View reader comments (0) » Comment on this story »
Register Citizen Staff
In the Berkshire League, composed of Class S-sized schools with a sprinkling of M’s, team numbers are always a factor. It’s especially true in wrestling, with 14 weight classes to fill.
Given enough athletes, even lacking precise fits, quality wrestlers often move up a class or two to fill the gaps. Teams that can fill all 14 slots often begin with a competitive advantage because forfeits cost six points in a match.
So, like other sports, but more so, the most successful BL wrestling programs are those that keep attracting new kids.
The best programs do it by locking them in early with middle school feeder programs or wrestling clubs that start kids earlier.
Year after year, defending champion Nonnewaug fields a bigger team than anyone else. Combined with quality coaching, that also makes the Chiefs a perennial league favorite.
As classy a program as any in the state, Nonnewaug has long served as the model for many BL programs, with a steady rise in the league’s prowess as a result.
Last year, three BL teams finished in the top 10 at the Class S State Tournament. Nonnewaug was second; Thomaston, sixth; Gilbert, ninth. Terryville (11th) and Housatonic (15th) waited just outside in the field of 32.
The Chiefs went on to ninth place in the State Open.
As important as a steady feeder stream is to wrestling teams, graduations can be even more costly than in other sports; in wrestling, experience counts for everything.
Speed and strength are important add-ons, but, without experience, newcomers are easily lost in a physical chess game in which the best wrestlers think two moves ahead.
A four-year wrestler isn’t apt to be easily replaced by an underclassmen unless training began in a youth program.
In a strong league last year, everyone lost key wrestlers. Nonnewaug, Thomaston, Terryville and Gilbert, perhaps in that order, are most likely to have people moving up the pipeline to vie for top spots in the league and states.
At the same time, all eight of the area schools that produce wrestlers — Gilbert, Housatonic, Nonnewaug, Northwestern, Terryville, Thomaston, Torrington and Wolcott Tech — are guaranteed to have standout individuals.
A sports that requires numbers for team success remains a battle of single warriors in the spotlight, using wits, experience, speed and strength to dominate, survive or avoid embarrassment.
GILBERT
Coach: Doug Smith, 10th year
Last year: BL Tournament 4th; Class S 9th of 32 teams.
Key losses: Xavier Dubois, 152 Class S 4th; Ross Lopardo 171 BL Champ, Class S runner-up.
Key returners: Josh Hoxie 112/119 sr, Class S and BL 103-pound Champ; Brigitte Smyth 112/119 sr, BL 112-pound runner-up; Andrew Smith 119 soph; Alek Smith 130 sr, BL Champ, Class S 3rd; Sean Blackwell 135 jr; Dylan Jeferies 140 jr, BL 135-pound runner-up; Grant Dziedzic, 140 jr; Jake Minard, 189 soph; Michael Kampartas, 215 soph.
Key Newcomers: Ansari Moonis 112 fres; Nick Holland 140 fresh.
Team outlook: Smith has built a solid program at Gilbert, but needs more numbers and experience to surround his all-state caliber seniors.
HOUSATONIC
Coach: Thomas Medonis, 1st year
Last year: 3-12; BL Tournament 7th; Class S 15th of 32 teams.
Key losses: Ryan MacLaren, 171.
Key returners: Dom Ghi 119 sr, Class S 3rd; Conor MacLaren 135 soph; Tyler Spaddacini, 140 soph, BL runner-up; Steve Wingard, 160 jr, BL runner-up, Class S 4th; Dom Sanchez; Kevin Arel; Nameer Abo-Hamzy.
Key newcomers: Zach Wilcox; Hannah Arel.
Team outlook: The Mountaineers have some quality wrestlers to lead them, but, like Gilbert, lack numbers and experience.
NONNEWAUG
Coach: Dave Green
Last year: BL Tournament Champs; Class S runners-up; State Open 9th.
Key losses: Andrew Miller 140; Dane Denslow 145, BL runner-up; Jon Hutter 152, Class S 6th; D.J. Hardesty 160, BL Champ, Class S 3rd; Ronnie Walter 285, BL, Class S, State Open Champ.
Key returners: Alex Paparazzo 103 sr, BL runner-up, Class S runner-up; Quentin Mylie, 112 jr; Austin Hodges 119 jr; Tyler Tilbe 125 sr, BL, Class S, State Open Champ; Brian Reilly 130 sr, BL runner-up, Class S 4th; Matt Cucci, 135 jr; Jon Rubano 171 sr; Paul Caisse 189 sr, BL runner-up; Sal Longo 215 jr.
Team outlook: The Chiefs are the BL wrestling standard setters in most years. They have high-quality wrestlers to replace, but the numbers in their program mean someone else finally gets his chance. Nonnewaug will be at or near the top again.
NORTHWESTERN
Coach: Andrew Schwartz, 2nd year
Last year: BL Tournament 6th; Class S 22nd of 32.
Key losses: Shawn Rich 103; Dan McColter 112; Will Kelsey 119; Mike Budny 152 BL Champ.
Key returners: Kyle Smith 125 sr, BL runner-up; Wayne Ibitz 140 soph; Taylor Lewis 160 sr; Nick Hotchkiss 171 jr; Jon Coleman 189 jr; Tim Zeitler 285 sr, BL, Class S runner-up.
Outlook: Coach Schwartz’s enthusiasm has taken his team from seven wrestlers last year to 12 this year. Three seniors, including two BL runners-up, will lead an otherwise young team.
TERRYVILLE
Coach: Peter Veleas
Last year: BL Tournament 3rd; Class S 11th
Key losses: Joe LaCourse 125; Cody Benson 171; John Draper 189, BL Champ, Class S 3rd, State Open 5th
Key returners: Josh Rivard 103 soph; Dan Lupone 112 sr; D.J. Russo 119 sr, BL, Class S runner-up; Ben Russo 130 soph; Dan Blekis 135 sr; Scott LaMarre 140 jr, BL Champ; Dominic Folino 145 sr, BL Champ, Class S 6th; Jay LeGassey 152 jr; Alex Huizenga 160 jr; Aaron Goderre 215 jr.
Outlook: Terryville graduated just three starters, though one of them was a league champion. With what they have left in a strong program, the Kangaroos might be even better this year.

description.hltext_display: Forex: USD/CAD edges towards 1.0150
description.content:
FXstreet.com (Barcelona) - The USD/CAD has been on a steady decline since the beginning of Asian trading, with the pair easing nearly 30 pips from an overnight high at 1.0180. Around opening bell in Europe, the pair remains slightly bearish trading at low of 1.0153 where it awaits fresh direction on a day of thin volume.
With further vulnerability to the downside, immediate support is listed by the FXstreet live charts at 1.0135 and 1.0109. In the case of a rebound however, resistance is placed at 1.0221, 1.0247 and 1.0272.
The EUR/CAD similarly is trading around 30 pips lower from the days top high of 1.3360, lingering around 1.3330 as it tests support and attempts to bounce in the opening moments of Europe. Support is listed at 1.3222 and 1.3189 while resistance is placed at 1.3382, 1.3415 and 1.3449.

description.hltext_display: Davis joins Wilmington Regional Film Commission
Bahrain eyes nuclear power by 2017
description.content:
Bahrain plans to use nuclear power by 2017 and is considering privatising power distribution, a government minister said in remarks published on Wednesday. The Gulf Cooperation Council -- a loose economic and political alliance of six Gulf Arab states -- said in 2007 it was studying a joint nuclear programme to meet rising power demand.
The UAE last year awarded a South Korean consortium a contract to build four nuclear power plants and top oil explorer Saudi Arabia is also exploring nuclear energy. "It will be some time before we can adopt nuclear sources here in Bahrain as experts have to be brought in, designs prepared and facilities built, but our plan is to have it by 2017," Fahmi Al-Jawder, minister for electricity and water affairs, was quoted as saying in the Gulf Daily News.
Bahrain is a small producer of oil and gas. A close ally of the United States, it needs to find new sources of energy to meet demand in a growing economy.
It is currently building the 1,200 megawatt Al Dur power and water plant, in which France GDF Suez holds a 45 per cent stake.
Jawder said Bahrain also planned to privatise power distribution in the long term. "We have also privatised power production and there are plans to privatise distribution, but they are not in our immediate agenda," he said. Bahrain is facing rising fiscal deficits, partially due to its subsidies on power, water and fuel.

Easy Web Access to Computer Hardware and Software Inventory
description.content:
Tweet 10-Strike Software has announced 4.0, a powerful inventory program to maintain the database of Windows network computers´ hardware and software. The program provides network administrators with an effective solution to facilitate and streamline hardware and software network inventory management. is designed to audit hardware and software assets over the network and provide you with detailed and accurate reports on any data gathered by the program. With the extensive reports provided by the program, a system administrator can plan upgrades more accurately, and significantly decrease upgrade costs. The program enables the administrator to decide what to buy without wasting time and effort on checking everything manually. The license audit feature helps to count installed applications, track serial numbers, and find pirated software. allows users to scan their network and find computers, add them to the inventory database, gather data from them, and track all the changes during future scans. The information collected by the program after the first audit is logged so that an administrator could track the history of changes. This history log includes information on installed and uninstalled software, added and removed devices (even USB flash drives), and changes in the system configuration, for example, new users, hotfixes installed, new autorun items, etc. The program can be configured to update the inventory data automatically and send the information on the changed items to the user via email. This can prevent potential operating system problems and even track the available disk space, thus maximizing productivity.
The main change in the version 4.0 comparing to previous versions is the web interface added. It allows remote users to connect to the inventory database using a web browser and watch the hardware and software installed on computers. Another new important function is ability to watch the file system structure and the registry on remote computers. A user can check whether the remote machines have some files on disks or have some certain value stored in the registry.
The flexibility of the program allows using an agent-free solution employing the WMI technology (Windows Management Instrumentation), agent-based solution, and client application to audit targeted machines. The version 4.0 allows the program to import the client data files via FTP and email. This helps to employ the inventory program in distributed networks when there is no ability to connect to computers in remote offices and departments directly, but there some common FTP and mail servers available via the Internet. 4.0 greatly enhances the network management efficiency.
Pricing and Availability 4.0 is compatible with Windows 2000, XP, Vista, 7, Server 2003, Server 2008, and even with Windows 98/NT (with WMI core installed). The 25-PC license cost starts from just $99.95 (US). Registered users are entitled to free upgrades and priority e-mail support.
About 10-Strike Software
Founded in 1999, 10-Strike Software specializes in the development of advanced networking, administrative and searching solutions for Windows. The company´s goal is to assist corporate users all around the world in solving their network management needs. For more information please visit http://www.10-strike.com/
# # #
NOTE TO EDITORS: Please, let us know if you have any questions or would like any additional information on 4.0. Contact Dmitriy Stepanov at pr } 10-strike(.)com

description.hltext_display: Snimanje božićne čestitke kardinala Bozanića
description.content:
Zagreb, (IKA) - Snimanje božićne čestitke zagrebačkog nadbiskupa kardinala Josipa Bozanića za elektroničke medije bit će u petak 24. prosinca u 11 sati u prostorijama Nadbiskupskog dvora u Zagrebu (Kaptol 31).
Božićnu čestitku kardinala Bozanića za potrebe televizije snimat će Hrvatska radiotelevizija, a ostale televizijske kuće moći će je kao i prethodnih godina preuzeti od Hrvatske radiotelevizije.
Audio snimku božićne čestitke za potrebe radija, zainteresirane radijske postaje moći će preuzeti na internetskim stranicama Zagrebačke nadbiskupije www.zg-nadbiskupija.hr poslije 14 sati istoga dana.

description.hltext_display: Liberty Global mulls over bidding for German Kabel Baden-Wuerttemberg
Tax cut deal earns lump of coal
description.author: Steve Brawner
description.content: Do you believe in Santa Claus? You don’t have to, because Congress and the White House are real. President Obama last week signed an extension to the Bush-era tax cuts that had been negotiated with congressional Republicans. Every member of Arkansas’ current delegation voted for the agreement except for Rep. Marion Berry, who did not vote. President Obama and the Republicans negotiated the tax cut agreement in which each got most of what they wanted and nobody (except future taxpayers) had to make any real sacrifices. Then they congratulated each other for their successful “compromise.” The package included a two-year extension of the tax cuts, including cuts for the wealthy that had been so treasured by Republicans. Unemployment checks for seven million long-term unemployed Americans will continue to be mailed throughout 2011. Social Security payroll taxes will be cut by almost one-third. What was lacking? Spending cuts, for one thing, as well as any real recognition that our children and grandchildren will pay the price for this all-too-usual display of fiscal irresponsibility. Once again, elected officials in Washington are fulfilling the country’s wish lists without asking the country to pay for it. The decision to cut Social Security taxes at a time when everyone knows that system is going broke deserves the biggest lump of coal of all. This all happened not long after President Obama’s own deficit reduction commission very publicly reminded Americans of the need to make tough choices to address the national debt. That group’s deliberations were accompanied by significantly less back-slapping and self-congratulating in Washington. Polls show Americans overwhelmingly favor the agreement, which isn’t surprising, for who can be against Santa Claus? He gives without expecting anything in return. Next April, when our accountants give most of us the good news and the refund checks start appearing in our mailboxes, many will be even more supportive. But April 15 is not Christmas. It’s a day when grownups are supposed to accept the price tag for the government they have chosen. Unfortunately, time and again, Americans and their elected representatives have chosen to swipe our Chinese-issued credit cards and hand our children and grandchildren the bill. The three Arkansas representatives and two senators who voted for this package without offsetting it with spending cuts should be on every concerned Arkansan’s naughty list. Three of the five — Sen. Mark Pryor, Sen.—elect John Boozman and Rep. Mike Ross — will return to Washington. They will be joined by three new representatives, all Republicans and all elected after at least giving lip service to balancing the federal budget during the campaign. All six of them no doubt will promise to be good for goodness’ sakes and practice fiscal responsibility — someday. It’s time for someday to arrive. For far too long, Arkansans and their elected representatives have acted as if they believed the myth that the government can forever spend money it does not have because America’s sleigh is always full and always will be. Now it’s time for us all to accept the truth: A fat man can’t slide down a chimney. While there may or may not be a Santa Claus, debt is very real and bills have to be paid. Today’s grownups — not tomorrow’s — ought to be the ones to pay them. ??- Steve Brawner is an independent journalist in Arkansas. His blog — Independent Arkansas — is linked at Arkansasnews.com. His e-mail address is brawnersteve@mac.com.

description.hltext_display: 黑客半年盗号近500万个 攻击网站收“保护费”
description.content:
暴力木马
中国IDC评述网12月21日报道：淮安网民李某没想到，他本想痛痛快快地打个网游，哪知游戏装备莫名被盗，辛苦累计的金币也不翼而飞。正当他郁闷之时，全国有36万余名跟他一样的玩家遭到“黑手”。今年3月1日以来，在省公安厅网警总队统一指挥下，淮安网警侦办了一起“暴力木马”非法入侵计算机信息系统案。
3月1日，淮安市公安局网警支队接到网民李某报案，称其所玩的网络游戏“地下城与勇士”（简称DNF）账号中的游戏装备被盗。淮安网警调查发现，此番“中招”的并不只李某一人。据该游戏官方随后调查，全国共有36万余名玩家的电脑，受到“木马”感染，仅淮安市就有5000余名，造成大量游戏金币及装备被盗。
3月10日，淮安市公安局网警支队会同洪泽县公安局成立专案组，经过网上侦查，初步明确这种木马病毒，是以孟某为首的一个团伙制作、销售并传播的，同时摸清了以孟某为首的这个团伙结构，锁定了他们的位置。该案共抓获以孟某为主的7名犯罪嫌疑人，收缴涉案电脑10台，银行卡22张，涉案金额10余万元。这个团伙的成员都在20岁左右，不少是大学生，他们痴迷于黑客技术，通过黑客论坛认识，然后合作牟利，可彼此之间几乎没见过面。去年6月底，孟某编写了一种专门盗取“地下城与勇士”账号和密码的木马，并在自己掌握的服务器上搭建了一个平台（黑客称之为“箱子”），然后将这个“箱子”以每月500元价格出租给七八个代理。
2009年12月初，被暴利迷了眼的孟某用易语言，又重新编写了一种可以盗取“地下城与勇士”账号和密码的木马，命名为“暴力木马”。它能通过模拟“地下城与勇士”的登录界面，采用“钓鱼”的方式来获取玩家的游戏账号和密码。随着租用“箱子”的代理越来越多，孟某先后租用7台服务器来搭建“箱子”平台，“箱子”分基本功能和高级功能，基本功能只可以收取被盗来的网民们的游戏账号和密码，租金为400-700元/月；高级功能还可以对网民们的电脑远程实时截图、破解口令保护、踢人等，租金为700-1000元/月。
生命木马
3个月赚了20多万“黑钱”
又有网友中招！6月7日，徐州市鼓楼分局牌楼派出所接到一名网民报案，他玩网络游戏时遭遇盗号木马，账号和装备被偷了！而这款游戏，又是“地下城与勇士”。三周后，徐州网警将黑客廖某等8名犯罪嫌疑人抓捕归案。实际上，光今年上半年，以“生命”木马为主的几款木马，共盗取游戏账号500多万个，造成直接经济损失约2000万元。
6月7日，鼓楼分局牌楼派出所接到一名网民报案，说他在玩DNF（地下城与勇士）时，游戏账号被盗，里面有装备、游戏币等虚拟物品价值数万元。网警发现，这名网民跟淮安网民李某一样，也是下载游戏外挂后被植入木马的，致使账号被盗的。
虽然这款木马也是一种专门盗取腾讯公司DNF（地下城与勇士）游戏账号、密码的盗号木马，但跟淮安孟某一案使用的“暴力”木马不同，这次网民们被植入的盗号木马，代号“生命”。
这起案件被命名为“6.16”故意制作传播计算机破坏性程序案，鼓楼网警大队用了几天工夫，梳理出廖某这个黑客团伙。原来，廖某、罗某和彭某都是网络“黑客”，也是“生命”木马的三个作者，分别住在江西、四川和甘肃，彼此之间并不认识，是通过黑客论坛勾结在一起的。自2010年3月份开始，廖某、罗某、彭某三人为了赚钱，开发了专门用于盗取DNF游戏账号及密码的“生命”木马生成器，然后以每个木马生成器5000元的价格，直接销售给吕某、杨某等多名下家代理，由他们挂马实施盗号。

description.hltext_display: Explore The Multiple Types Of Swimming Pools
description.content:
What is it that can add real value to your real estate? Above everything else, it is a swimming pool that is a wonderful asset to houses. They are the perfect means to beat the burning summer heat. Everyone simply loves to plunge into the not so warm water and relax away! For swimming lovers, enjoying the pleasures of a pool in the backyard is not implausible. Many sorts of pools are available to go with diverse requirements.
Pools that are made above ground level, those below ground level, plus the portable variety, are accessible in the marketplace. Depending on the capitol, room availability, time and ease, one can pick the form of pool to be installed.
Above-Ground Swimming Pools
This category constitutes pools that are maintained above ground level. It happens to be the most inexpensive alternative amid the other swimming pools. They appear in three main shapes: rectangular, round and egg-shaped. When one does not want to dig up the garden and establish an in-ground pool, they are quite helpful. Additionally, above-ground pools are less expensive than in-ground ones, and even take up lesser time to install.
The majority of the above ground pools can be made with the aid of pre-fabricated kits. Consequently, any layperson can also get the pool installed without even hiring a service provider.
In-Ground Swimming Pools
In-ground pools are not just famous, but also, it fits the costly category. Those who are not rigid on budgets and available space go for these pools. As the name foretells, these pools are made into the earth, just above ground level. The advantage of choosing this kind of pool is that the dimension of the pool can be infinite. One can decide the length, height and width of the pool according to the size of the yard. This choice is not there in other types. One tiny little problem is that the maintenance costs for this kind are more than for the other swimming pools. In this category, there are four more divisions:
Vinyl-Lined In-Ground Pools are quite frequently used form of in-ground pools. In this category, soil is trenched, a casing is made for the pool, and sand is dumped at the base. Metal, wood or possibly plastic walls are made, which are subsequently creased with a vinyl liner.
Fiberglass Pools have lower maintenance costs, as opposed to the vinyl form. They are established only by trained pool installers, who bring along the fiberglass pool shell.
Poured Concrete Swimming Pool involves the draining of solid into wooden frames in order to complete its construction. This allows clients to pick their pool frames, which is why they were famous as the ideal form of in-ground pools known to date. Nonetheless, the fitting of this variety is extremely complicated and lengthy.
Portable Swimming Pools
There are inexpensive or economical swimming pools which can be moved from one area to another. These are also recognized as 'baby or kiddie pools' and, as revealed by its name; it can be packed, drained and moved to any place in the garden as per your wish. They are also great for your dog to cool off during the summer months.

description.hltext_display: America: Woman with gun shuts down evening news
description.content:
A gun-wielding woman has burst into a US television station, forcing the evening news bulletin off the air, though no one was injured, the station said.
After a brief stand-off with a police SWAT team that surrounded the building of ABC Charlotte, North Carolina affiliate WSOC-TV, the woman was taken into custody. ABC News said she had pulled out a gun and put it to her head, though police later learned the gun was not loaded.
A CBS affiliate in Charlotte, WBTV, identified the woman as Wendy Naidas.
The station went black during the incident, which interrupted its 5pm bulletin but was back on air an hour later. Employees were evacuated to the back section of a parking lot during the incident.
"Not on air. Distraught woman with gun in lobby. Police have building surrounded. Employees evacuated," WSOC-TV anchor Blair Miller said in a message on the Twitter microblog, from inside the station.
Start of sidebar. Skip to end of sidebar.
End of sidebar. Return to start of sidebar.
Police chief Rodney Monroe told WBTV that Naidas threatened the receptionist and herself while they were barricaded in the building. Although police initially said Naidas had fired at least one shot, Monroe later said no shots had been fired.

Spaniards to watch lottery numbers drawn
description.content: Millions of Spaniards will be sitting glued to their TV screens watching the country’s most popular lottery’s numbers drawn tonight. The prize pool exceeds 2 billion Euros. Yesterday 80% of the Spanish stood in long lines to buy the coupons. The lottery is Spain’s 200 year-old Christmas tradition.

description.hltext_display: Dachis Group Acquires Powered
description.content:
Tweet Acquisition significantly expands Social Business Customer Engagement practice, establishes New York presence, and creates the world’s largest Facebook Preferred Developer
Dachis Group, the world’s largest Social Business consultancy, announced Tuesday the acquisition of Powered Inc. and its operating subsidiaries StepChange Group, Drillteam, and crayon.
The acquisition significantly expands Dachis Group’s Social Business Customer Engagement practice, adding Powered’s significant expertise in social marketing, including strategy, planning, program development and execution, program management, content marketing, blogger outreach, influencer activation, advocacy programs, branded communities, and branded events. Powered’s clients include HP, Nike, Clorox, Frito-Lay, Ernst and Young, Toys “R” Us, T-Mobile, Kraft, H&R Block, Nestle, Toyota, Gillette, and Target.
“There is no escaping the impact of Social Business affecting every facet of every company at every level,” said Jeffrey Dachis, Founder and Chief Executive Officer, Dachis Group. “It is clear that to be truly effective, companies must be able to engage customers wherever they are, on whatever device they utilize, and in every way they can connect, communicate, and participate across the entire social engagement spectrum.”
“In our Social Business Customer Engagement practice, clients are asking us to help integrate their social efforts, and coordination becomes crucial,” said Peter Kim, Managing Director, Dachis Group North America. “With Powered’s capabilities and talent, Dachis Group enhances its ability to serve our global clients with a deep and effective offering across the social engagement spectrum.”
The transaction also establishes Dachis Group as the world’s largest Facebook Preferred Developer, extending the company’s ability to execute engagement strategies using Facebook Pages, Facebook Applications, and Facebook Connect integrations for global clients.
With Powered, Dachis Group expands the company’s existing North American footprint, establishing a presence in New York, New York, and also bolstering the company’s Austin, Texas and Portland, Oregon locations.
The acquisition increases the international firm to over 220 professionals in ten cities in five countries worldwide.
Dachis Group continues to grow to best serve their global client base, and will integrate Powered’s operations into the company’s Social Business Customer Engagement offering effective immediately.
Continuing the growth of the international firm serving clients in North America, Europe and Asia/Pacific, the combined company has offices in Amsterdam, Netherlands; Madrid, Spain; London, England; Sydney, Australia; Lincoln, Nebraska; New York, New York; Philadelphia, Pennsylvania; Portland, Oregon and St. Louis, Missouri, with its headquarters in Austin, Texas. About Powered
Powered is a social marketing consultancy that helps companies become more engaged in an increasingly digital, connected and social world. Utilizing a proven set of effective practices and technologies, Powered helps companies navigate the entire social marketing spectrum, providing social marketing: strategy, planning, program development and execution, program management, content marketing, blogger outreach, influencer activation, advocacy programs, branded communities, and branded events.
Since 2006, Powered has executed over 200 social marketing programs and worked with some of the world’s largest and most innovative brands. Powered’s clients include HP, Nike, Clorox, Frito-Lay, Ernst and Young, Toys “R” Us, T-Mobile, Kraft, H&R Block, Nestle, Toyota, Gillette, and Target. With 80 employees, and offices in Austin, New York City and Portland, Powered brings enhanced expertise to social marketing program development and execution, and has demonstrated a proven ability to deliver meaningful and measurable results.
To help companies realize the potential of social marketing programs, Powered acquired industry leaders crayon, Drillteam and StepChange Group in January of 2010.
Based in Portland, Oregon, StepChange Group, an original Facebook Preferred Developer, specializes in extending a brand’s presence into social networks such as Facebook, Twitter, and other social and mobile platforms including iPhone and Android. Clients include Nike, Clorox, Frito-Lay, Ernst and Young, Toys “R” Us, Intercontinental Hotel Group and T-Mobile.
Based in New York, crayon specializes in strategic consulting, and program and account management for social marketing programs. Clients include Kraft, Panasonic, Coca-Cola, H&R Block and American Airlines.
Based in New York, Drillteam specializes in social activation, earned media, integration with online promotions and offline events, blogger outreach and advocacy programs. Clients include Nestle, Saucony, Toyota, Gillette, Target and Neiman Marcus.
Powered operates the Panorama community platform and the Hosties brand experience Facebook platform. About Dachis Group
Dachis Group is the world’s leading Social Business consultancy.
Through its three main Social Business practice areas, Social Business Strategy, Social Business Engagement, and Social Business Intelligence, Dachis Group helps large organizations become more connected and engaged with their constituents. The company has developed a framework for Social Business Design by addressing organizational transformation across business systems, process, and culture. Social Business Design is connecting with your customers + your workforce + your enterprise to create powerful business value.
Dachis Group serves over 15% of the Fortune 500 with representative clients including American Express, AOL, AT&T, Bud Light, Calvin Klein, Chevrolet, Chrysler, Cisco, Citibank, The Coca-Cola Company, COVERGIRL, DeVry, Dodge, Doritos, ESPN, Estee Lauder, HBO, HP, IBM, Intel, JetBlue, Lexus, McDonald’s, Microsoft, Motorola, Nike, Pabst Brewing, Procter & Gamble, Red Bull, Samsung, Sprint and Yum! Brands.
Dachis Group was founded in 2008, by Jeffrey Dachis. The company offers services around the globe with offices in ten cities in five countries, employing over 220 professionals. Dachis Group is headquartered in Austin, Texas with offices in Lincoln, Nebraska; New York, New York; Philadelphia, Pennsylvania; Portland, Oregon; St. Louis, Missouri; London, England; Sydney, Australia; Amsterdam, Netherlands; and Madrid, Spain.
Dachis Group operates as: Dachis Group; Archrival, a Dachis Group company; crayon, a Dachis Group company; Drillteam, a Dachis Group company; Headshift, a Dachis Group company; Powered, a Dachis Group company; StepChangeGroup, a Dachis Group company; Stuzo, a Dachis Group company; XPLANE, a Dachis Group company and The 2.0 Adoption Council, a Dachis Group company.
The company’s strategy is backed by a financial commitment from Austin Ventures to build and grow organically and through acquisitions.
If you are interested in finding out how Dachis Group can help your business, contact: inquiries } dachisgroup(.)com
Stay on top of the most current thinking on Social Business Design in the Dachis Group Collaboratory.
To learn more about Social Business Design, download our Social Business Design white paper.
Dachis Group is always looking for talented individuals and leaders, contact: opportunities } dachisgroup(.)com
For press inquiries, contact Jenny Murphy: jenny.murphy } dachisgroup(.)com
For more information, contact: info } dachisgroup(.)com
Dachis Group 515 Congress Avenue, Suite 2420 Austin, Texas 78701 512.275.7825

description.hltext_display: Shift in mood, DMK rallies behind Raja
A Romantic Gift Idea That Will Fill the Night with Passion and Intrigue
description.content: Nowadays, glamorous gifts are really getting extinct. Unlike in the past, you will repeatedly see people bringing roses and chocolates to their significant other to show their affection and appreciation. Today, you will see people sending glamorous emails with virtual cards. And, as you may imagine, this is not really very charming. In fact, your significant other may just delete your email after they read it.So, what can you do to spice things up a bit with your loved one?Well, you can consider giving them a wine gift basket even on regular days. This will really send the message that you desire and appreciate them and it will also show your thoughtfulness.If you don't have a clue on how to create a glamorous wine gift basket, here are some tips that will really help you out.The first thing you have to do is to get the basket. Today, there are available premade wine gift baskets for any type of occasion. There are wine gift baskets designed for traditional holidays, such as Christmas and New Year, and there are also enchanting wine gift baskets that are already decorated and ready to be filled with the wine and an assortment of treats.After getting the wine gift basket, the next thing you have to do is get the wine to put in the basket. Never get a cheap bottle of wine. Instead, go for mid range bottles you know that tastes great. If you don't have any idea about wines, you should ask a wine expert about it or you can simply ask the winery clerk. They will be more than happy to educate you with your lack of knowledge about wines.If you want to make it discretionary special and you have the money for it, you should go for vintage bottles. This will surely be appreciated by your significant other especially if he or she is a wine enthusiast.Now that you have the bottle of wine, the next step is to fill the basket with his or her favorite treats. You can start by adding fine chocolates or cheeses. You have to keep in mind that chocolates and cheeses go well with most wines and as you may already know, chocolates are natural aphrodisiac, which will surely fill the night with flirting and desire.Also, you have to get two wine glasses in the basket along with a wine bottle opener. Two white or red dining napkins will also enhance its appearance.Rose petals in the wine gift basket are discretional but it will surely add to the effect.After this, you're now ready to present the wine gift basket to your significant other and enjoy it together.With a wine gift basket, you will surely spice up the night. You can be sure that your night will be filled with fondness and courting with a wine gift basket. Also, try not to forget about the charming card. This is the perfect way to tell your significant other about how you feel about them.Wine gift baskets will turn a regular evening with your loved one in to a night filled with fun, excitement, excitement and flirting.

description.hltext_display: Blogg: Årets spel. Plats 3
description.author: malmer
description.content:
Castlevania: Lords of Shadow
Utvecklare: Mercurysteam Utgivare: Konami Släpptes: 7:e oktober
Det är lätt att avfärda Lords of Shadow som en billig God of War-kopia, men då gör man sig själv en stor otjänst. För när God of War och många andra spel bara samlar ihop diverse mytiska begrepp i en stor smältdegel och låter det bli en ursäkt för att ha lite olika monster att slå på så gör Lords of Shadow något annat.
Ihop med det tillfredsställande stridssystemet och ljuvlig design så bygger de en sagovärld med hjälp av klassiska mytiska väsen där berättelsen är en väv av dunkla motiv och stark symbolik.
När andra spel försöker imponera mig med mer och större brutalitet och våld så målar Castlevania upp sin storslagna värld med en ständig blick inåt - vad som händer i hjärtat. Det blir en historia om stark kärlek och hopp i hopplöshet och förlåtelse för det oförlåtbara. Symboliken är som sagt stark och för den som tänker ett steg till finns många subtila nivåer av berättande.
Till det så är miljöerna är bland de vackraste jag sett och förstärks av musiken som passar perfekt. Striderna är fantastiskt roliga och det finurliga magisystemet gör att det håller och känns fräsht genom hela det långa spelet.
När eftertexterna rullar har jag gapat av häpnad flera gånger och kämpat genom horder av fiender utan att tappa modet. Och jag har framför allt blivit betagen av berättelsen. Därför förtjänar Castlevania: Lords of Shadow sin tredje plats på min lista av årets bästa spel.

description.hltext_display: Audiences TNT: Carton d'audience pour TMC
description.content:
TMC proposait à 20h40, "90 Enquêtes" animé par Carole Rousseau. Le magazine qui, traitait "La folie de Noël: Comment réussir ses fêtes?" a séduit 1.215.000 personnes, soit 4.5% de PDM. Un excellent score qui permet à la chaîne d'arriver en tête.
W9, proposait "Le meilleur des tubes", animé par Faustine Bollaert. Le divertissement a attiré 854.000 personnes, soit 3.0% de Pda. La chaîne arrive en deuxième position.
Quant à France 5, le documentaire "L'air du temps", consacré à Michel Berger, fédère 674.000 personnes, soit 2.4% de Pda.
France 4 misait sur "Fantomas se déchaîne". Le film a rassemblé 661.000 téléspectateurs, et réalise 2.4% d'audiences.
Sur Gulli, "Kirikou et les bêtes sauvages" a été regardé par 415.000 personnes, soit 1.5% de Pda.

description.hltext_display: Foodies fight with film school for space in LA
description.content:
LOS ANGELES -- Fans of the Hollywood Farmers Market are hoping for a permanent resolution to the permitting dispute that's been threatening the weekly produce bazaar.
Organizers have until mid-April to reach an accommodation with the adjacent film school that has been refusing to sign off on the market's permit.
Los Angeles Film School officials say the market blocks an entryway into one of the school's parking lots for several hours each Sunday.
Organizers say shifting the stalls that block the lot to another part of the market would result in the loss of many vendors. They say that could cut back on revenue they use to support smaller markets in the city's poor neighborhoods.

description.hltext_display: 12月21日病毒播报：木马利用QQ发假中奖信息
description.content:
中国IDC评述网12月21日报道：在今天的病毒里，需要谨慎防范“罗伯特”变种sec和“广告徒”变种oha。
英文名称：Backdoor/RBot.sec
中文名称：“罗伯特”变种sec
病毒长度：442368字节
病毒类型：后门
危险级别：★
影响平台：Win 9X/ME/NT/2000/XP/2003
MD5 校验：f6b18a6642d1b5b87d3b61e3c26b882d
特征描述：
Backdoor/RBot.sec“罗伯特”变种sec是“罗伯特”家族中的最新成员之一，采用COM技术编写，经过加壳保护处理。“罗伯特”变种sec运行后，会在“HKEY_CURRENT_USER\software\bnwork\settings\previewpages”下记录病毒感染信息。设置键盘鼠标钩子，并且监视IE浏览器窗口。后台开启远程访问等服务，还会弹出内容为“请执行主程序”的对话框。在被感染计算机系统的后台用POST方法连接骇客指定的URL“bnflow.zajindan.com/bnflow/ds/connect.php?/a=bn2”，获取恶意程序下载列表，然后从指定的站点例如“www.sll*j4.cn”、“www.alli*ge.com.cn”、“www.5*a.com”、“gg0*87.cn”、“mm9*60.cn”、“3322.org”、“61.160.*.80”、“as*aa.cn”、“ptp*ever.net”、“c1*2c.cn”、“nach*as.cn”、“8866.org”等下载恶意程序并自动调用运行。其所下载的文件可能为网络游戏盗号木马、远程控制后门等，会对被感染系统用户造成更多的威胁。
英文名称：Trojan/Swisyn.oha
中文名称：“广告徒”变种oha
病毒长度：44544字节
病毒类型：木马
危险级别：★
影响平台：Win 9X/ME/NT/2000/XP/2003
MD5 校验：5ced39e13de6327bbfef13c4c18706d2
特征描述：
Trojan/Swisyn.oha“广告徒”变种oha是“广告徒”家族中的最新成员之一，采用“Microsoft Visual Basic 5.0 / 6.0”编写，经过加壳保护处理。“广告徒”变种oha运行后，会自我复制到被感染系统的“%SystemRoot%\”文件夹下，重新命名为“Gt.exe”，以此实现开机自启。“广告徒”变种oha运行时，会在被感染系统的后台定时访问指定的恶意站点“web.heisell.com/AddSetup.asp?”，以此对被感染系统进行数量统计。检测当前系统中是否运行着腾讯QQ，如果发现则弹出虚假中奖信息，以此诱骗用户点击。当用户点击这些信息后，会自动访问骇客指定的站点“hxxp://qq2*0lo.info/”，从而可能给用户带来更多的威胁，例如遭受网络诈骗或网页木马等的侵害。其还会在被感染计算机的后台秘密窃取当前系统的配置信息，然后从骇客指定的远程站点“ip213.com:2010/ip.asp”下载恶意程序并调用运行。其所下载的恶意程序可能为网络游戏盗号木马、远程控制后门或恶意广告程序（流氓软件）等，致使用户面临更多的威胁。

description.hltext_display: BASE METALS - European Opening View - Sentiment remains strong, although there is room for profit-taking
description.content:
In Shanghai the March contracts are mixed, copper is down 0.4 percent to Rmb 68,700, zinc is down 0.5 percent at Rmb 18,760, while aluminium has bucked the trend with a 0.5 percent gain to Rmb 16,685. The rise in aluminium prices seems tied into the constraints on power due to cold weather that is likely to prolong production cuts or even create additional ones. Spot copper in Changjiang rose 0.7 percent to Rmb 68,000 to 68,400, thus narrowing the contango. However, the price difference between LME and Shanghai continues to increase with imported LME prices now some $640/tonne above Shanghai prices.
The dollar has eased a bit overnight with the dollar index at 80.49, the euro has clambered back to 1.3135, the aussie remains strong at 0.9975, the pound is weak at 1.5485, while the yen is last at 83.66. Gold is firmer at $1,389 and oil is strong at $90.05. Equities the Dow closed up 0.5 percent yesterday and this morning trading has been mixed in Asia with the Nikkei down 0. 2 percent, the Hang Seng basically unchanged, Chinas CSI is down 1 percent and the broader MSCI Asia Apex is up 0.2 percent so only China is showing some direction, but that was after strong gains yesterday.
The economic agenda is quite busy today with GDP data out in the UK and US and existing home sales and house price index out in the US, see table on right for more details.
Overall the tone across markets is bullish and that suggests the market is gearing up for a strong run up into the holiday season and year-end although we would expect choppy trading as high prices attract some profit-taking.

description.hltext_display: Schools: Algonquin cruises in the pool
description.content: Junior Mike Ficenec won the 200 individual medley and the 500 freestyle and Algonquin routed Worcester 99-39 in a non-league coed swimming meet.

description.hltext_display: Online sellers' price war intensified
description.content:
Amazon.cn, one of China's famous online retailers, intensified the price war in the e-commerce market by offering a price-off promotion on 28 kinds of it its online goods, morning.sc.cn reported Wednesday.
360buy.com started a price war Dec14 by offering 20 percent discount on books for its members. Two days later, its rival Dangdang.com, the nation's top online book seller, started a 40-million-yuan price-off promotion. But on the same day, 360buy.com also retaliated by announcing they would spend 80 million yuan to offer a discount on its goods, according to the report.
Amazon.cn intensified the war Dec 20 by offering a 100-million-yuan discount promotion on 28 kinds of goods, including clothing, commodity, foods, digital products, domestic appliances, cosmetics and baby products. It declared the goods will be sold at the lowest price of the online stores, and continued its discounts on book sales.
Insiders told the newspaper that a price war will not be an effective way to win buyers as consumers have formed their own consumption habits. E-commerce companies should try to improve consumer loyalty while offering favorable prices.

description.hltext_display: New York: Rabbi charged with killing former cop
description.author: Heather Yakin of the Times Herald-Record
description.content:
A NEW York grand jury today indicted a rabbi and two associates on first-degree murder charges in the slaying of a former cop and his nephew. Former Lloyd police sergeant Francis Piscopo, 49, and his nephew Gerald Piscopo, 28, of Highland, were found dead November 4 from gunshot wounds inside a vacant house on Liberty St in Newburgh, about 97km north of New York City.
According to an indictment, three men - Victor Koltun, 41, of Bayville, New Jersey, who has said he is a rabbi; Frank Lewis, 56, of Brooklyn; and Craig Fennell, 51, of New York City - conspired to kill the Piscopos in a murder-for-hire plot. "The allegation is that Koltun hired the others to kill the Piscopos," District Attorney Frank Phillips said.
The men were charged with four counts of first-degree murder, two counts of second-degree murder, two counts of second-degree conspiracy and a felony gun charge.
All three were being held without bail pending arraignment Wednesday before Judge Jeffrey G. Berry in Orange County Court.
Read more at the Times Herald-Record

description.hltext_display: 版署：互联网出版物不得汉语随意夹杂外国语言
description.content:
中国IDC评述网12月21日报道：12月21日，新闻出版总署下发了《关于进一步规范出版物文字使用的通知》。通知规定，纸、期刊、图书、音像制品和电子书、互联网等各类出版物禁止出现随意夹带使用英文单词或字母缩写等外国语言文字。
新闻出版总署方面表示，着经济社会的发展，在报纸、期刊、图书、音像制品和电子书、互联网等各类出版物中，外国语言文字使用量剧增，出现了在汉语言中随意夹杂英语等外来语、直接使用英文单词或字母缩写、生造一些非中非外、含义不清的词语等滥用语言文字的问题，严重损害了汉语言文字的规范性和纯洁性，破坏了和谐健康的语言文化环境，造成了不良的社会影响。
此次出台的通知要求，出版媒体和出版单位要进一步加强外国语言文字的使用规范化，尊重并遵循汉语言及所使用的外国语言文字的结构规律和词汇、语法规则。在汉语出版物中，禁止出现随意夹带使用英文单词或字母缩写等外国语言文字；禁止生造非中非外、含义不清的词语；禁止任意增减外文字母、颠倒词序等违反语言规范现象。汉语文出版物中需要使用外国语言文字的，应当用国家通用语言文字作必要的注释。外国语言文字的翻译应当符合翻译的基本原则和惯例。外国人名、地名等专有名词和科学技术术语要按有关规定翻译成国家通用语言文字。
据悉，根据规定，互联网出版物是指互联网信息服务提供者将自己创作或他人创作的作品经过选择和编辑加工，登载在互联网上或者通过互联网发送到用户端，供公众浏览、阅读、使用或者下载的在线传播的产品。
其中，互联网图书、互联网报纸、互联网杂志、互联网音像出版物、 互联网电子出版、手机出版物、互联网学术出版物、互联网文学出版物、互联网教育出版物、互联网地图、互联网游戏出版物等都在互联网出版物之列。（雷风）
以下为通知全文：
各省、自治区、直辖市新闻出版局，新疆生产建设兵团新闻出版局，解放军总政治部宣传部新闻出版局：
报刊、图书、音像制品和电子书、互联网等各类出版物作为大众性的重要传播媒介，是语言文字规范化的实践者和宣传者，多年来，在规范使用语言文字，宣传促进语言文字规范化方面作出了重要贡献，为正确使用语言文字起到了积极示范作用。但是，随着经济社会的发展，在报纸、期刊、图书、音像制品和电子书、互联网等各类出版物中，外国语言文字使用量剧增，出现了在汉语言中随意夹杂英语等外来语、直接使用英文单词或字母缩写、生造一些非中非外、含义不清的词语等滥用语言文字的问题，严重损害了汉语言文字的规范性和纯洁性，破坏了和谐健康的语言文化环境，造成了不良的社会影响。
今年10月31日是《中华人民共和国国家通用语言文字法》发布10周年纪念日，出版媒体和出版单位要以此为契机，大力宣传《国家通用语言文字法》，并在出版工作中认真贯彻执行有关法律规定。为进一步促进语言文字的规范化、标准化，认真贯彻中央关于规范出版语言文字使用的要求，依据《中华人民共和国国家通用语言文字法》、《出版物汉字使用管理规定》及新闻出版有关法律、法规、规章，现就进一步加强规范出版文字使用的有关问题通知如下：
一、充分认识规范使用汉语言文字的重要意义。各类出版媒体和出版单位要高度重视出版物文字规范化工作，严格执行规范汉语言文字这一基本的语言文字政策，把宣传和规范使用汉语言文字作为传承中华文明、促进社会主义精神文明建设的一件重要职责，在出版活动中切实贯彻落实有关规范汉语言文字的法律法规。
二、严格执行规范使用汉语言文字有关规定。出版媒体和出版单位要采取有效措施，严格执行《出版物汉字使用管理规定》第五条“报纸、期刊、图书、音像制品等出版物的报头（名）、刊名、封皮（包括封面、封底、书脊等）、包装装饰物、广告宣传品等用字，必须使用规范汉字，禁止使用不规范汉字。出版物的内文（包括正文、内容提要、目录以及版权记录项目等辅文），必须使用规范汉字，禁止使用不规范汉字。”等有关条款，坚决抵制不良文化倾向，正确使用汉语言文字，为促进汉语言文字的规范化和健康发展发挥示范带头作用。
三、高度重视规范使用外国语言文字。出版媒体和出版单位要进一步加强外国语言文字的使用规范化，尊重并遵循汉语言及所使用的外国语言文字的结构规律和词汇、语法规则。在汉语出版物中，禁止出现随意夹带使用英文单词或字母缩写等外国语言文字；禁止生造非中非外、含义不清的词语；禁止任意增减外文字母、颠倒词序等违反语言规范现象。汉语文出版物中需要使用外国语言文字的，应当用国家通用语言文字作必要的注释。外国语言文字的翻译应当符合翻译的基本原则和惯例。外国人名、地名等专有名词和科学技术术语要按有关规定翻译成国家通用语言文字。

description.hltext_display: Working with a Dog Coaching Collar For Helpful Coaching
description.content: Most canine owners would like to have a lot more handle over their canine with a shock collar . When it comes to employing a canine coaching collar you will have far more comfort and more management, and have the capability to educate your canine more effectively.There is a sort of dog instruction collar that tends to glimpse a small daunting, these are referred to as shock collars. This is the prong collar it is very successful for controlling large, thick-necked canines. This sort of shock collar applies a gentle shock. It will not do any harm to your canine as the shock is gentle and does not damage. It simply steers your dog in the correct path. This kind of shock collar is really useful in a short quantity of time.There are a lot of forms shock collars for all varieties of coaching. You should have it fitted effectively, it can't hurt your pet if used effectively. If you are a new canine owner, this kind of canine coaching collar is not suggested proper absent. When it comes to choosing the suitable shock collar for your pet, be confident to get 1 for the sort of teaching you want to do. When it comes to a teaching collar, study and find out about the collar for correct use. Any canine coaching collar you pick will have full directions that are simple to stick to.Most dog find out quite speedily with a shock collar and the sooner they study the sooner it can be removed. Make positive to reward your canine when he does one thing appropriate he will discover a lot more quickly this way. Don't be discouraged from employing a instruction canine collar they are incredibly safe and particularly successful.

description.hltext_display: Malaysia can become 'manufacturing hub for carmakers'
整治网络和手机等扫黄 手机店下载别“涉黄”
description.content:
中国IDC评述网12月22日报道：临近年关，各种报刊、音像制品店成为“扫黄打非”的关注对象。12月21日，记者从自治区“扫黄打非”办获悉，除传统出版物市场外，手机、网络传播淫秽色情信息等行为也是集中整治的重点。
手机店下载信息别“涉黄”
广西“扫黄打非”部门于11月~12月开展了手机电脑市场专项整治工作，对各地手机电脑销售和维修店开展拉网式排查。对于传黄贩黄的手机电脑店、以及顶风作案为客户下载和预装淫秽色情信息的，当场予以取缔、没收相关设备并依法给予相应处罚。
据了解，工商等有关部门已对辖区内的手机电脑销售和维修店逐一登记备案，并加强日常监管巡查，一旦发现有为客户下载淫秽色情等有害信息的行为，将依法严查。校园周边的手机、电脑销售和维修店是重点监管对象。
南宁未发现涉黄手机店
在排查工作中，南宁市“扫黄打非”办联合文化市场综合执法单位，对市区内的手机销售维修企业及学校周边进行了暗访和摸底，重点检查了这些企业是否存在下载、复制、传播淫秽色情及低俗信息等非法经营行为。经查，南宁市尚未发现有手机销售维修店和流动摊点下载、传播淫秽色情等有害信息非法经营活动。

description.hltext_display: Peace Sign Tattoos: Their Meaning In A Modern World
description.content: Arising in the 1960s the peace sign symbolized passivity, world peace in general, a peaceful outlook and more specifically peace in Vietnam. As more and more people have chosen to show their leanings with tattoos, today's peace sign tattoos stand for much more.You will be hard pressed to find a symbol more recognized than the peace symbol. It was designed on February 21, 1958, by Gerald Holtom, who was an artist in Britain. It was first used for the Campaign for Nuclear Disarmament (CND). Many do not know that he used naval semaphores as the basis for his design. (The semaphore is a signaling system where flags are held in each hand in different positions. Each position of the arms and hands indicate a different letter or number. The two letters N for Nuclear and D for Disarmament were used in the symbol to represent peace. The N is formed by holding two flags down in an upside down V, and the letter D is formed by holding one flag pointed straight up and the other pointed straight down. It was first used in 1958 during a Easter weekend anti-nuclear march.A peace symbol tattoo can stand for many things including serenity, harmony, tranquility, freedom, non-violence, silence, calmness, hope, victory, pacifism, respect, justice and goodwill. For some it represents art. For others it is simply another popular tattoo choice, like cross tattoos or star tattoos. As such artful designs they may not mean anything on a grander scale to most. Like heart tattoos that say Mom and the like, they can merely be iconic tattoos for those who only want to get inked.But for others, in fact, for most, their tattoo designs are very personal.Peace sign tattoos have a broader scope of typical meanings than the peace sign jewelry, clothing and necklace designs so frequently marketed by the man (corporate America).Though we don't tend to acknowledge our troops as we did in WWI and WWII, our young men and women are still serving in the armed forces overseas. Tattoos are a way for them to announce their views in a more permanent fashion, either commemorating those who died in service, or their desire for peaceful times and to be home.The GLBT community are partial to rainbow peace sign designs. Presumably because it symbolizes peace for their community.For others it represents, oddly enough, a rebellion of sorts, and as such, the opposite of peace. Those who still espouse the drug scene, the rebellious music popularized in the 60s and the counter culture mentality.It can stand for peace with oneself or with one's family, as well as larger organizations; all derivations on the original hippie meaning.Peace signs can be found most anywhere on the body. Some of the most popular include peace sign tattoos on feet, arms, shoulders and the hip. For some reason foot tattoos are very popular. I suppose it is because the peace symbols fit so well near or on the ankle.If you are looking for unique tattoo ideas for peace tattoos you can look at celebrity designs, pictures in magazines,

description.hltext_display: 5 civilians killed in Afghanistan
description.content: At least 5 civilians were killed in a shoot-out between the ISAF forces and Taliban militants in the southern Afghan province of Helmand on Wednesday, media reports said. The dead civilians were found after the exchange of fire, with Taliban insurgents reportedly using them as a human shield.

description.hltext_display: Fire store brande i nat
description.author: BIRGER A. ANDERSEN
description.content:
Fire kraftige brande gav i nat travlhed for brandfolk i både Jylland og Sjælland.
I Horsens lød alarmen kl. 23.33 om en kraftig brand i en firelænget gård på Torsted Alle.
- Det lykkedes at få reddet hovedbygningen i bindingsværksgården med stråtag, men resten af gården nedbrændte. Heldigvis kom både beboerne og deres hund ikke noget til ved branden, oplyser vagtchef Jesper Duus fra Sydøstjyllands Politi til bt.dk. Læs også: Årsagen til den kraftige brand er endnu ukendt. Den skal brandtekniske undersøgelser i løbet af onsdagen forsøge at klarlægge.
I Havndal ved Randers mistede en person onsdag morgen livet i en villabrand. Læs også: Det vides ikke, om den omkomne er identisk med husets beboer, oplyser Østjyllands Politi til Ritzau.
Brandvæsnet er stadig på stedet. Det er også uvist, hvordan og hvor branden er opstået.
Også på Sjælland var brandfolk i aktion ved to voldsomme brande i nat.
På Amager måtte 61 boere i en etageejendom evakueres under en kraftig tagbrand, og i Søborg nord for København blev 10 biler flammernes bytte ved en omfattende brand, der ødelagde et 400 kvadratmeter stort autoværksted med tilhørende garager. Læs også:

description.hltext_display: 工信部解读被聚焦“2010通信产业十大关键词”
description.content:
http://www.idcps.com2010-12-22 09:06:16 飞象网 关注度(101) 我要报料 进入论坛
中国IDC评述网12月22日报道：昨日，通过专家委员会综合评议与网友投票，工信部电信研究院发布了“2010年通信产业十大关键词”，三网融合、物联网、云计算、移动互联网、智能手机、网络与信息安全、3G发展、移动支付、TD-LTE、微博等入围榜单。工信部电信研究院副总工程师陈金桥对其一一进行解读。
关键词一：三网融合 行业监管体制上仍需突破
对于三网融合，陈金桥表示，三网融合于2010年正式起步，“特别强调要做加法，一加一等于七，共同做大增量市场，做好交替部分，彼此促进才是未来的方向。”
陈金桥称，2010年是三网融合政策的破冰之年，三网融合政策的推出是顺应技术发展的必然趋势。同时，三网融合也赋予运营商全业务运营的新内涵，给其带来新机遇。
不过，“三网融合并非简单的三屏融合，也不是简单的技术和业务的融合，三网融合对制造业、服务业均有影响。”陈金桥指出。
值得一提的是，陈金桥认为，目前三网融合最大问题是行业利益以及部门利益，“未来一年，三网融合在行业监管体制上仍需要突破，”陈金桥强调。
关键词二：物联网 物联网将加速社会信息化进程
物联网的概念于1999年由美国麻省理工大学提出，早期物联网是依托射频识别(RFID)技术的物流网络。随着技术和应用的发展，物联网的内涵发生较大变化，当前，物联网已成未来信息通信技术的发展趋势。
陈金桥称，物联网概念在未来十年时间里不断演进，其中，从传感器网到物联网是前段后端的体现，是网络资源的利用和通信的服务对象，同时也是传感器网络向后扩张的结果。
他强调，泛在物联网以行业垂直应用为主，已渗透到国家基础命脉行业。尤其重要的是，电信运营商以泛在物联网应用发展为契机，加速了向综合信息服务商的转型，同时也将加速全社会的信息化进程。
关键词三：云计算 我国政府、运营商积极跟进
云计算作为2010年一种新的业务模式，对于未来降低信息化成本，加速推动信息化速度的作用不可小觑。目前，在我国国内，政府与运营企业都在积极跟进。
飞象网获悉，云计算作为中国移动蓝海战略的一个重要部分，于2007年由移动研究院组织力量，联合中科院计算所，着手启动“大云”项目。同时，中国电信也发布了“翼云”计划。
陈金桥表示，云计算实现了IT产业从提供产品到提供服务的巨大转变，它不仅将改变ICT产业的面貌，也将深刻改变社会经济生活的方方面面。同时，云计算对于未来降低信息化成本和加速推动信息化速度具有很大作用。
关键词四：移动互联网 连接速度和流量负担影响用户体验
手机网民的迅速增加推动了移动互联网发展。数据统计，截至2009年年底，使用手机上网的网民达到2.33亿人，占整体网民的60.7%，而只使用手机上网的网民达到3070万，1年内手机网民增长1.2万，增长了106%。
其中，在移动互联网应用中，使用率最高的依然为即时通信和阅读类，有77.8%的手机网民使用手机聊天功能，75.4%的手机网民使用手机阅读功能；手机搜索和在线收听/下载音乐使用率分别为55.2%和50.4%，组成手机上网应用的第二梯队；而手机网游、手机邮件、社区及博客等处于第三梯队。
陈金桥表示，移动互联网商业模式驱动数字内容产业发展。来自IDC数据显示，2008年全球固定互联网收入约为910亿美元，移动互联网收入约为370亿美元。不过，“移动互联网的收入结构与固定互联网不同，固定互联网方面广告占40%，电子商务占35%，付费服务为25%，而数字内容只占5%的收入份额。”

description.hltext_display: El sorteo de Navidad reparte hoy más de 2.320 millones de euros
description.content: El Sorteo de Navidad llega como cada año cargado de premios y repartirá hoy más de 2.320 millones de euros. Además, este año el tradicional sorteo, que ya ha comenzado, trae importantes novedades como una nueva sede de ceremonias en el Palacio de Congresos de Madrid o la posibilidad de cobrar los 'premios mayores' al día siguiente.

description.hltext_display: パキスタン政府への請求却下
Attributes of Star Seeds
description.content: Star seeds are said to be the genetic children of Aliens, having the DNA structure of the Alien host parent and the planet from which they come from, they are humanoid in appearance and they may also carry other traits as well such as plant or animal.Star seeds have different attributes that will distinguish them from each other, as well as their human cousins, starting with their basic appearance such as the eyes; they possess a certain influential pull in them. Star seeds have a particular charm in their personalities that is a little unnerving. Their body temperature is below the normal temperature of a human. Their backbones are transitional and sometimes they may have an extra spine, most of the time they will have more allergies than a human child and be vulnerable to atmospheric changes and even allergic to light. Star seeds will wake at night and will work more thoroughly than they can in daylight and then sleep during the day. They have a purer form of love for their parents, they also believe that their natural parents are only surrogates, and their birth parents probably live and work off planet. They assume that their brethren belong to some other starting point.They are quick to finish their tasks and feel that there is a shortage of time in all jobs allotted to them; therefore they will finish them without delay. One honestly unusual thing that has been observed, related to star seeds is that they seem to be connected to the spirit realms or have many imaginary friends.These friends are mostly not visible to the naked eye. They may even be connected to other dimensions and are relating to creatures of the rift. They usually possess mystical abilities which are not considered natural by anyone around them. Some are highly exceptional in the fields of Art and Science and in their work they will show their perceptions and imaginations of their planet of origin. We humans feel a certain lure to the Star seeds and they have a fascination towards rocks and translucent formations, they are engrossed by the stars in the sky and they show anticipation by thunder storms. For Star Seeds death is a ritual of transformation and is the unavoidable process for all.

description.hltext_display: Lotería de Navidad: Las ventas del sorteo se mantienen como en 2009, cerca de 2.700 millones
description.content: Las ventas del sorteo de Navidad se han mantenido relativamente estables respecto al año pasado, con una caída del 0,2% hasta cerca de los 2.700 millones de euros, según ha adelantado el director general de Loterías y Apuestas del Estado (LAE), Gonzalo Fernández. Fernández ha subrayado en una entrevista a TVE recogida por Europa Press que, teniendo en cuenta que el año pasado las ventas cayeron un 3% en relación con 2008 y la actual "situación económica" de España, la caída del 0,2% de 2010 puede ser entendida como "una remontada, un inicio de cambio de ciclo". Por otro lado, sobre la entrada de capital privado en LAE, anunciada por el Gobierno, Fernández ha comparado la situación de LAE con la de otras empresas españolas hace años y ha afirmado que tiene "la visión" de que, en un plazo de cinco a diez años, Loterías y Apuestas del Estado se convertirá en "una gran empresa en el mundo internacional en el juego".

description.hltext_display: Beijing: Web censor hounded off own blog
description.author: correspondents
description.content:
THE man widely seen as the architect of China's vast Internet censorship system known as the "Great Firewall" has had to take down his microblog after a storm of criticism by web users. Fang Binxing, the 50-year-old president of Beijing University of Posts and Telecommunications, has removed his microblog on popular web portal Sina.com just a few days after launching it, the Global Times has said.
Mr Fang is sometimes called the "father of the Great Firewall" - a system designed to filter out any information deemed sensitive or politically harmful by China's Communist government.
Facebook, YouTube and Twitter are among those blocked by Chinese censors.
Thousands of Internet users flocked to Mr Fang's microblog within hours after spotting his first posts, mostly mocking or cursing him, despite rapid deleting of the comments by Sina editors, the . "Before, the GFW deprived people's right to freely access the Internet, now people will deprive your right to use a microblog. You should not regret this, should you?" the report cited one comment as saying. "Animal. Running dog of the government, lower than animals," another wrote. "He is the enemy of all netizens who are forced to scale the wall all day long," said another. Many of the comments used expletives, according to the China Digital Times, a bilingual web project based at the University of California, Berkeley, that collates news on China from across the Internet.
China has the world's largest online population of over 420 million users, who have made the Internet a forum in which to express opinions in a way rarely seen in a country where the traditional media are under strict state control.

description.hltext_display: US suits against Pakistani spy chief face hurdles
description.content:
NEW YORK -- The plaintiffs in two U.S. lawsuits accusing Pakistan's spy chief of nurturing terrorists involved in the 2008 Mumbai attacks are hoping for a historic outcome recalling the Lockerbie settlement, but they would have to overcome serious legal obstacles first, lawyers and experts say.
The civil complaints naming Gen. Ahmed Shuja Pasha and his Inter-Services Intelligence agency as defendants are like past lawsuits filed in federal courts against overseas figures with alleged links to terrorist attacks and other atrocities.
A lawyer for the U.S. plaintiffs, John Kreindler, said Tuesday that they hope to win a deal like the one struck with Libya over the 1988 bombing of Pan Am Flight 103 over Lockerbie, Scotland. The $1.5 billion settlement announced in 2008 was seen both as a victory for the families of 180 Americans killed in the terrorist attack and as a diplomatic breakthrough with the North African nation, once a pariah.
"The hope is to obtain appropriate compensation, but we also see it as a chance for the United States and Pakistan to join together and condemn terrorism," he said.
"I think our chances are very good," he added. "We wouldn't be doing it if it was simply for show."
But experts say a U.S. court could find that Pasha, as a high-ranking foreign official, is protected by sovereign immunity. Even when not protected, many international defendants don't bother to respond to summonses and, as a result, never see the inside of an American courthouse or engage in settlement negotiations.
Judges can hear testimony from the plaintiffs and order damages, but the chances of collecting are a long shot. In some cases, judges have tossed out cases after the U.S. government opposed them on diplomatic grounds.
"Lawsuits like this aren't highly successful," said John F. Murphy, a professor at Villanova University School of Law in suburban Philadelphia. "Decisions that have been favorable to the plaintiffs have been largely symbolic."
In Pakistan, prominent lawyer Athar Minallah said Tuesday that with the U.S. court's jurisdiction in question, he couldn't see the litigation getting very far.
"Why should they even bother to respond?" Minallah said of Pasha and the ISI.
An ISI representative said Tuesday that Pasha had received a summons but declined to discuss the case further.
The wrongful death lawsuits were filed last month in federal court in Brooklyn by relatives of victims in the Mumbai attacks, which left 166 people and nine attackers dead. The assault has been blamed on the Pakistani militant group Lashkar-e-Taiba, which is also named as a defendant.
